This new loan will allow Ogougba Augustine to increase the level of her business and to grow her revenue. The previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and fabric.

loans.name: Famatta

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Famatta from Liberia; she is married and her husband is a contractor. They have four children aged between six and 20. All four of them live at home and are currently attending school. She lives in the Caldwell area; this area is becoming one of the populated communities in Montserrado due to some factors such as good roads, quietness, and the lower cost of renting houses. 

For over ten years now she has been selling palm oil, pepper, okra, rice etc in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday and spends nine hours each day on her business. She stated that her main challenge is the rainy season, but she does make some profits at that time. She started this business with money from her husband, and learned how to run the business from her friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, pepper, okra, rice etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, pepper, okra and rice for her business.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 62 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta el segundo grado, sus padres necesitaban que les ayudara en todas las tareas agrícolas, fue así como aprendió con su papá al cuido de ganado y la agricultura. Esta acompañado y tiene 3 hijos su esposa es ama de casa. Actualmente siembra 14,000 mts cuadrados de maíz, 7,000 de plátano y tiene 8 cabezas de ganado, todos los días después de llevar sus animales al potrero, tiene que irse al cultivo a realizar labores de limpieza, control de plagas y malezas.

José, para salir a comprar sus novillos, camina un kilómetro a pie, atraviesa cultivos  de caña  desde su casa hasta la calle principal de la comunidad, ahí aborda un camión de los que van al tiangue y viaja 45 minutos, al llegar a la plaza, tiene que buscar los animales que le gustan, después de hacer trato, los sube al camión y viaja de regreso a casa.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar 5 novillos para engordar y luego vender, con esto  incrementa el lote de novillos y  las ventas de ganado serán mas continuas 

En un futuro, Josè quiere comprar un vehículo para transportar el alimento del ganado.
texts.en:
José, 62, could only study up to the second grade. His parents needed him to help them with their agricultural activities and this is how he learned from his father how to raise livestock and grow food. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife.

José is currently working on 14,000 m2 of corn and 7,000 of plantain, and has eight steers. Every day, after taking his animals to graze, he goes to his plantations to clean them and get rid of plagues and weeds.

José needs to walk one kilometer to buy animals. He walks through the sugar cane fields, from his house to the main street in his community, where he takes a truck that takes him to the market, 45 minutes away. Once he arrives, he has to look for those animals he likes the most and after reaching an agreement, he loads the truck and goes back home.

With this loan, he will buy five steers to fatten and sell. He will increase the amount of animals he owns and his sales will be more constant. In the future, José would like to have his own vehicle to transport feed for his animals.

loans.use: to buy five steers to fatten.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 45 years old and is from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two grown children. For four years now, Zenaida has been raising hogs to generate an income.  

Zenaida works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She takes every opportunity to earn a living. As of this time, Zenaida lacks the financial resources to improve her hog-raising business. She is requesting a loan to buy feeds for the pigs so she will not worry on a daily basis. 

Zenaida dreams of expanding her venture to generate more income so that she will experience life's comfort in her old age.

loans.use: to buy hog feed.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
You are welcome to meet a 22-year-old business woman called Musu from Liberia; she lives in the Caldwell area of Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the more populated communities in Montserrado due to some factors such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of rental houses.
 
Musu is married and her husband is a driver; together they have two children ages two and seven. Only one lives at home and is currently attending school. 

For more than five years now she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday working ten hours each day. She stated that her main challenge is the rainy season, but she does make some profit during that time. She started this business with money from her husband and learned how to run the business from her friends.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build her house and educate all her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 40 years old. She is married with three children aged between five and fifteen. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, potatoes and lotions for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rice, potatoes and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Abraham Mamer

texts.en:
Abraham is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. He is a 45-year-old father of five children. All his children go to school. He is a businessman who owns a butchery. He has been doing this business for four years now and employes four people to help him run the business.

Abraham is borrowing a loan worth 4,000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable him to purchase more cows for his butchery. The loan will be paid back from the business profits. He will also use the loan to pay school fees and purchase medication for his family.

loans.use: To buy cows for the butchery.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a mother of three children. She is 31 years old. Her husband works as a farmer. She has sold fabrics for the past five years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more fabrics to make more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family and make savings.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to make more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha happily explains about her life to us (BRAC Liberia) saying: “I am Oretha, 45 years of age. I am a high-school graduate, married and I have three children by my present husband. Our children are between 24 and 30 years old. I have been selling palm oil for ten years now without facing any problems in my business except for my limited capital as I am thinking of expanding my business. 

That is why I am asking for a 17,000 LRD loan to buy more palm oil to sell. My business helps in my home, and also paying for my house rent. No one taught me how to sell but I saw other women selling, so I took a small amount of money from my husband to start this business, and now it is helping us.  My future plan is to open a shop and build a house.”

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou, âgée de 57 ans est un agriculteur qui a une expérience de plus  de dix ans dans ce domaine. Il est marié et père d’une famille nombreuse, c’ est pourquoi, il s’active jusqu'à  présent dans les champs avec l’appui de ses enfants et neveu. Mamadou vient solliciter un crédit de 250000F CFA afin d’acheter de l’engrais et des pesticides et cultiver son espace.
Mamadou peut désormais faire de l’épargne pour prévoir les imprévus et les probables besoins de son foyer. Le crédit a impacter aussi sur les conditions alimentaires de la famille. 
Malgré son âge, Mamadou a un vœu, celui d’être ou de faire parti des plus grands producteurs du Sénégal.
texts.en:
Mister Mamadou, 57 years old, is a farmer who has more than ten years experience in this field. He is married and father to a large family. This is why he has been active until now in the fields with the support of his children and his nephew. Mamadou is requesting a loan of 250,000 FCFA in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides and cultivate his area.

From now on Mamadou can save to plan for the unexpected and the probable needs of his home. The loan has also impacted the nutritional conditions of the family.

Despite his age, Mamadou has a wish - to be or be part of the largest producers in Sénégal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the cultivation of his cultural area.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
You are welcome to meet Bendu, a 25-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the more populous communities in Montserrado due to some factors such as good roads, quietness, and lower housing rents. Bendu is single with two children aged 3 and 5. They live at home, and only one is currently attending school. 

Over that last 3 years now, Bendu has been running a table-top shop selling copy-books, pencils, pens, etc. in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday for 9 hours each day. Her main challenge is the rainy season, but she makes more profit during this time. She started this business selling with her mother from whom she learned the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more copy-books, pencils, pens, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house and educate all of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more copy-books, pencils, pens, etc. for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Montserrado County, more precisely she lives in the Caldwell area. She is 43 years of age, and a sixth grade dropout. Victoria is married to a local businessman; they have four children living at home and attending school. Her first child is 22 and her last child is 16.

Victoria is presently selling small-small-things like soap, pepper, rice, candles, sardines, etc from a table in the local market. She’s been doing this for ten years now.  She explains that the rainy season is the major challenge she faces in her business. 

She learned trading from her mother and established this business with money from her.  Victoria explains how helpful her business has been in supporting her children over the years with their schooling and feeding. She has requested a 20,000 LRD loan in order to buy addition goods to sell.

Her plans are to become a big business woman and educate all her children.

loans.use: to buy addition goods to sell.

loans.name: Union Fait La Force Group

texts.fr:
Améyo est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Améyo fait partir du groupe "UNION FAIT LA FORCE". Ce groupe est constitué de 20 femmes dynamiques qui mènent des activités génératrices de revenus afin de venir en appui à leur mari dans les dépenses de leur ménage respectifs. Améyo a démarré la vente des produits de premières nécessités depuis plus de 18 ans. Malgré qu'elle ne soit pas scolarisé, elle fait l'effort de gérer son activité. 
Actuellement avec les formations reçue, elle est plus avertit dans la gestion de son petit commerce.
Ce crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter 2 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Améyo is a 43 year old woman. She is married and mother to 4 children. Améyo is part of the group "Union Fait La Force." This group consists of 20 dynamic women who manage income generating businesses in order to support their husbands with the expenses of their respective homes. Améyo started selling staples more than 18 years ago. Despite the fact that she did not go to school, she makes the effort to manage her business. 

With the training she has received, she is currently more informed in the management of her small shop.

The loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 2 bags of corn.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of corn.

loans.name: Twizeraneiii Group

texts.fr:
Adidja  fait partie du groupe  Twizerane et  habite à Cibitoke. C’est une veuve de  37 ans. Elle a 3 enfants âgés de 20 à 24 ans.
Elle a sous sa charge 3 enfants orphelins.

Elle fait le commerce du riz, tomates,… depuis  13 ans. 

C’est son  premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  100 kg de riz   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  avoir le nécessaire pour vivre (nourriture, habillement,…)et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Adidja is part of the group Twizerane and lives in Cibitoke. She is a 37 year old widow. She has 3 children who are from 20 to 24 years old. She has 3 orphan children under her care.

She has been selling rice, tomatoes, ... for 13 years.

This is her first loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that she receives, she is going to increase her capital and buy 100 kg of rice to resell to make more.

In the coming years, she would like to have what is necessary to live (food, clothing, ...) and see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy 100 kg of rice to resell to make more.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is aged 29. She is married with two children. With the loan, she has requested she will buy more rice, cooking oil and sugar to sell.

With the profits from the business she will provide food for the family. She was very much helped by the previous loan, which upgraded her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Mariah`

texts.en:
Please meet 24-year-old Mariah. She is from Liberia, and lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the more populous communities in Montserrado due to some factors such as good roads, quietness, and lower housing rent. She is married with three children between 2 and 8 years old, which live at home and attend school. 

For the past 2 years she has been selling fish in the local market. She sells for ten hours each day from Monday to Saturday. One of her main challenges is the high price of fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 42 years old and lives in the Caldwell area of Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the populated communities in Montserrado County due to some factors such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of rental houses.
 
Hawa is married and her husband is a businessman; together they have three children between 6 and 12 years old. The children are currently in school and live at home. For the past fourteen years she has been selling rice, salt, pepper, vita, etc in the local market, she makes a lot of profit and has many customers. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, salt, pepper, vita, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build her house and educate her children. She would like to say thanks to the donors of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, salt, pepper and vita for her business.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 31 years old. She works as a tailor and has been in the business for the past three years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more fabrics from which she can make clothes which she will sell to make more income. As a tailor she believes the profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business to expand it and get more returns in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Matenneh

texts.en:
Matenneh is 32 years old and lives in the Caldwell area of Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the populated communities in Montserrado County due to some factors such as good roads, quietness and the lower price of rental houses.
 
She is married and has three children aged between 14 and five. Her three children are currently in school, and they all live at home. For three years Matenneh has been selling used clothes in the local market. She enjoys the location of her business since it's situated in a very good position not far from the road. 

She has many customers and the need for her products is very high, although sometimes business is slow, but almost all of the time she makes good money. She asking for a 18,000 LRD loan to buy used clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.fr: Valéria est une femme de 42 ans,marié,mère de 06 enfants âgé entre 11 et 26 ans.Trois de ces derniers vont encore à l'école.elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 16 ans déjà où elle vend des vivres frais(plantains,manioc,ignames,noix de palmes)selon les saisons.Son activité fonctionne bien ,mais cependant il se pose le problème de l'insuffisance de ses marchandises par rapport à la demande car son capital ne lui permet guère de satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus grandissante.elle sollicite dont à nouveau  ce crédit afin de pouvoir acheter ses vivres en grande quantité ce qui lui permettra d'éviter les ruptures de stock permanentes mais également de satisfaire et augmenter sa clientèle et par conséquent ses bénéfices.bénéfices qui lui permettront d'étendre son activité et d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Valéria is a 42 year old woman, married and mother to 6 children whose ages range from 11 to 26 years old. Three of these children still go to school. She has been a shopkeeper in a market in the capital for 16 years already, where she sells fresh foodstuffs (plantains, manioc [cassava], yams, palm nuts) according to the seasons. Her business is doing well, but nevertheless has the problem of insufficient merchandise with respect to demand because her capital hardly allows her to satisfy this clientele which is growing more and more. Thus she is requesting this loan again in order to be able to buy her foodstuffs in large quantities which will allow her to avoid permanent stock shortages and equally to satisfy and increase her clientele and consequently her profits. Her profits will allow her to expand her business and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods wholesale (cassava, palm nuts, yams, plantains).

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 10 De Noviembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 16 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Rosa es una muy buena de ama casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a solventar los gastos que generan el hogar y la educación de su hijo se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y cosméticos. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres a cuatro días a la semana sobre todo por las mañanas ya que a esa hora es más fresco y se le hace más fácil salir a vender sus productos los mismos que en su mayoría ya son para entregar, ella lleva más de 17 años en este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante. 
Sus sueños son seguir creciendo en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The communal bank group "10 de Noviembre" meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its nationally and internationally recognized crafts.  This is the place of the famous Panama hats.

Rosa lives here.  She is forty-six years old and lives in a common-law marriage.  Through this relationship, she has three children; two children are older, and the other is sixteen and is studying in high school.  Her husband is a tradesman.

Rosa is a very good housewife.  In order to obtain her own income, and thereby help to cover home and school expenses, she makes a living selling natural products and cosmetics.  She sells door-to-door, and works three to four days a week.  She works in the mornings, since this is the coolest part of the day; the cooler temperature makes it easier for her to deliver and carry her products.  She has been doing this for more than seventeen years, and it has allowed her to move herself forward.

This loan will be used to buy natural products and cosmetics.  She has been with the communal bank since its beginning, and she likes it because the loans help her to get ahead.  

Her dreams are to continue growing in both her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: to buy natural products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Dialegne 15 Group

texts.fr:
Takku Liggey Dialegne 15 est un groupe qui rassemble cinq femmes qui s’active toute dans le commerce de détail et qui se sont unis partageant le même quartier.
Leur présidente, la dame Fatou,qui se trouve au milieu sur la photo est mariée et mère de famille.Elle vend des chaussures et des colliers. Il a une expérience de plus de huit ans dans ce domaine.
Grace aux revenus de l’activité, elle appui son mari dans les charges de la maison, et peut régler ses petits besoins personnels.
Fatou veut ouvrir un grand magasin de vente d’effets pour femme.
texts.en:
Takku Liggey Dialegne 15 is a group that gathers together five women who are all active in retail shopkeeping and who united because they live in the same neighborhood.

Their president, the woman Fatou, is found in the middle in this photo and is married and a mother. She sells shoes and necklaces. She has more than eight years experience in this field.

Thanks to the revenue from this business, she supports her husband with the responsibilities of the home, and can take care of her small personal needs.

Fatou wants to open a department store selling personal effects for women.

loans.use: to buy shoes and necklaces to resell during this holiday season which is approaching.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 35 years old, and she lives in the Caldwell area of Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the most populated communities in Montserrado County due to some factors such as good roads, quietness, and the lower price of rental houses.
 
She is married with four children aged between 20 and 17. The children live at home and attend school. She is stopped her education in 8th grade. For the past two years she has been selling oil, pepper, rice, etc in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days in a week, from 7AM to 5PM. Most of the time she uses a taxi to get her goods to her shop. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, etc for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper and rice for her business.

loans.name: Aquenei

texts.en:
Aquenei is 34 years old and she lives in the Caldwell area of Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the more populous communities in Montserrado due to some factors such as good roads, quietness, and lower housing rents. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They both have two children aged 7 and 9 years old. They live at home and attend school. 

For the past four years Aquenei has been selling cosmetics. She started this business with money from her husband. One challenge she faces is lack of commodities. She is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics for her business. She likes her business, because it helps her save money. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchases cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Valeria Del Socorro

texts.es: Valeria tiene 22 años de edad, ha pasado muchas dificultades económicas al lado de su familia, actualmente estudia la carrera de Lic. en derecho, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada que tiene gracias al apoyo de su madre, con esta actividad se ayuda a pagar sus gastos universitarios. Ella solicita el crédito para pagar su curso de titulación y postgrado, para poder ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
Valeria is twenty-two years old.  Her family has experienced many economic difficulties.  Presently, she is working towards a law degree.  She also has a small business selling used clothing.  She has this business thanks to the support of her mother, and it helps her to cover university expenses.

She is requesting a loan to pay the fees to finalize her degree and postgraduate courses; this will make her degree official and allow her to begin her career.

loans.use: to pay the fees to finalize her degree and postgraduate studies.

loans.name: Fanny Leonor

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 10 De Noviembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Fanny, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos  mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Fanny es una muy buena madre y esposa que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, hace 9 años se hizo cargo del bar de una escuela de la localidad, ella prepara todo lo que le que les vende a los niños como empanadas, tortillas, corviches, ceviche de pescado  además de jugos naturales y nutritivos, día a día varia el menú para no aburrir a sus clientes y es la razón por lo cual sus niños están muy contentos y consumen lo que ella les lleva.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la ayuda  que le dan con los créditos.
Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "10 de Noviembre" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture, and for its artisan products, which are known at both national and international levels.  It is from here that the famous Panama hats originate.

It is here that Fanny lives.  She is 52 years old, is married and has four adult children.  One of the children still lives at home.  Fanny's husband is a builder.  

Fanny is a very good mother and wife and likes to work in order to help her husband get ahead.  Nine years ago Fanny took over the food stall at a local school.  She prepares food to sell to the children - she makes pastries, tortillas, "corviche" (a fish and banana dish), and "ceviche" (a fish dish), as well as natural and nutritious juices.  Every day Fanny varies the many so her customers do no get bored.  As a result the children are very happy and eat whatever she brings to sell.

Fanny will use this loan to buy supplies to prepare the food.  She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and likes the help she receives through the loans.

Fanny's dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Josefa Jesús

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 10 De Noviembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Josefa, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos uno mayor de edad y el menor que estudia en colegio ambos aun viven en su casa.
Doña Josefa es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos sacar adelante sola a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja todos días más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esa hora es más fresco, además  tiene varios clientes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus productos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de  semana. Tiene más de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Ella está desde hace 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "10 de Noviembre" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture, and for its artisan products, which are known at both national and international levels.  It is from here that the famous Panama hats originate.

Josefa is a great housewife and, in order to earn her own income and help her children to get ahead, she sells all types of clothing, as well as Avon and Lebel products (beauty products, make-up, perfumes, and women's accessories).  Josefa sells door-to-door and works every day, particularly in the mornings when it is cooler.  In addition, Josefa has customers who come to her house to buy products.  Josefa sells on credit and collects payments every weekend.  She has been doing this work for over eleven years and it is going very well for her.

Josefa will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, make-up, and clothes.  She has been with the communal bank for seven years and likes it because of the help she receives through loans.

Josefa's dream to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothes.

loans.name: Erka Maricela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 10 De Noviembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Erika, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en  colegio y el siguiente en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Erika es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos aportar para cubrir los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y u forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres a cuatro días más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en la escuela y es más fácil salir a ofrecer sus productos, también vende en su casa si algún cliente necesita de alguna prenda, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de  semana. Tiene más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo aunque lo que más vende es ropa de damas. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The "10 de Noviembre" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture, and for its artisan products, which are known at both national and international levels.  It is from here that the famous Panama hats originate.

And it is here that 30-year-old Erika lives.  She is married and has two children, aged eleven and five years old.  The eldest is studying in high school, the youngest in primary school.  Erika's husband is a driver.

Erika is a great housewife who, in order to earn her own income and to help cover household costs, has a business - she sells all types of clothing.  Erika sells from door-to-door some three or four days each week.  She mainly works in the morning as her children are in school and it is easier to go out and sell her products.  Erika also sells out of her home if one of her customers needs any items.  Erika sells on credit and goes round to collect payments every weekend.  Erika has been doing this work for over eight years and it is going well for her.

Erika will use this loan to buy all kinds of clothes, though she mostly sells women's clothes.  Erika has been with the communal bank for five years and likes it because of the help she receives through the loans.

Erika's dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres en Accion está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer en qué situación esta cada una de ellas y conforme a eso poder ayudarlas y orientarlas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de Carbón, y cuenta que gracias a su trabajo está ayudando a su familia y dando lo que necesitan para poder salir adelante. Le está yendo muy bien su emprendimiento, ya que la venta de carbón esta cada vez mejor porque es más barata.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas e invertir en su negocio y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres en Accion group is part of a program seeking to eliminate proverty. The women each determine their own situation and learn how to help themselves.

One of the members is Sra. Maria who earns her living selling charcoal. Through this work she is able to help her family and provide them with what they need to get ahead. Her work is going well as sales of charcoal are increasing due to the low price of charcoal.

Maria is seeking a loan to buy more charcoal so she can continue with this work, invest in her business, and carry on supporting her family.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Kiromiddin

texts.ru:
Киромиддин занимается растениеводством. Он ответственный и целеустремленный мужчина. Киромиддин серьезно был озадачен о расширении своей деятельности. Он купил 10 соток земли и хочет посадить на половину орошаемого участка земли картошку на другую половину пшеницу. Каромиддин раньше работал простым трактористом и много знает о работе на земле. Его многолетний опыт роботы поможет ему в его деятельности. С такими планами он обратился в МДО "Хумо". Полученные деньги от кредита пойдут для закупа семян пшеницы и картошки. Киромиддин смела может готовиться к осеннему посему, потому что у него есть люди, которые всегда придут к нему на помощь - это его жена, дети и родной брат.
Также у него есть надежда, он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Kiromiddin is a crop farmer. He is responsible and goal-oriented, and is thinking seriously about the development of his business. He bought 10 acres of land and wants to plant half of the irrigated area with potatoes, and the other half with wheat. Kiromiddin previously worked as a tractor driver and is knowledgeable about working the land; his many years of experience will help him in this undertaking. 

With these intentions, Kiromiddin applied for a loan with MDO Humo. The loan will be used to buy wheat and potatos. Kiromiddin can be confident as he prepares for autumn planting because there are people in his life who will always come to his aid - his wife, his children, and his brother. He is also hopeful, and he thanks you for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and potato seeds

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Sadia from Moriba town Bo. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 years and 19 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. She began this business because she wants to be self-sufficient.

Sadia runs a general store business. She sells soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week for 10 hours per day.  Sadia says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Sadia has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Sweeties

texts.en:
Sweeties is 22 years old. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the more populous communities in Montserrado due to some factors such as good roads, quietness, and lower housing rents. Sweeties is single with a 2-year-old child who is in school. They live at home with Sweeties' family. 

For the past 5 years Sweeties has been selling slippers and shoes. One challenge she faces is high wholesale prices. She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers and shoes for her business. She likes her business, because it helps her feed and educate her child. Her plan is to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Yamarie

texts.en: Meet 49-year-old Yamarie from Moriba town in Sierra Leone. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 10 years and 27 years old. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2008, Yamarie established her wood business. She began her business because she needed to establish a source of income to support her home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that her business is doing well, because she is able to earn enough for her daily meal from the profit. Yamarie requires a loan in order to purchase wood for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Eleanor plans to open a grocery shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase wood for resale.

loans.name: Robiyakhon

texts.ru: Робияхон живет со своим сыном в городе Исфара. Робияхон развелась с мужем, имея двух сыновей. Ее старший сын уехал на заработки в Россию. Младшему 16 лет, он учится в школе в 10 классе. После школы он помогает маме на рынке. Робияхон продает кондитерские изделия такие как: печения, пряники, конфеты, вафли и многое другое. Она занимается с таким видом деятельности более 10 лет. Правильно преподнести товар и общаться с клиентами ее научила подруга. Этим уроком она пользуется до сегодняшнего дня. Цель получения кредита Робияхон является приобретения товара из города Худжанд. Она хочет привезти новые продукты, пряники разного вида и мармеладные конфеты. Она надеется, что привезенные сладости оценят покупатели и Робияхон приобретет еще больше постоянных клиентов.
texts.en:
Robiyakhon lives with her son in the town of Isfara. Robiyakhon is divorced her husband and has two sons. Her elder son left to work in Russia. The younger is 16 years old and is a student in the 10th class. After school he helps his mother in the market. Robiyakhon sells confectionery products such as: biscuits, cakes, candy, waffles, and more. She has been involved in this kind of activity for more than ten years. From her good friend, she learned how to correctly showcase goods and to communicate with customers. She uses these lessons to this very day. 

The purpose of this loan is for Robiyakhon to purchase goods from the city of Khujand. She wants to bring new products, different kinds of cakes and marmalade candy. She hopes that buyers will appreciate the sweets and Robiyakhon will acquire even more loyal customers.

loans.use: to purchase sweets from Khujand

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Исматулло житель района Хамадони. Ему 23 года. Он еще не окончил университет, но уже начинает отрывать свой бизнес. Берет кредит, чтобы начать свою деятельность. На деньги от кредита он хочет купить маслобойное оборудование для будущего маслобойного цеха. Исматулло со своим братом намерен заняться этим бизнесом. И они собираются сами работать в цехе и за полученный доход развивать свое дело. Но пока у них есть только помещение. Когда Исматулло купит нужное оборудование, это даст ему и его брату работу, средство дохода и нескучное дело.
texts.en:
Ismatullo lives in Hamadoni. He is 23 years old. He has not yet graduated from the university, but is starting his own business. He is taking out a loan to start the business. 

With the money from the loan he wants to buy oil pressing equipment to build an oil processing business. Ismatullo and his brother are going in business together. They're planning to do the work themselves to make money to invest in their business. But so far, they only have a room. When Ismatullo buys the necessary equipment, it will give him and his brother a job, a means of income, and interesting work.

loans.use: buy an oil mill to open an oil processing business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 47 years old. She sells different items in her boutique. She has requested a loan to buy more sugar, rice, and salt for resale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more rice and salt for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado Nueva Esperanza están en el 1er ciclo con trece integrantes, ellas se unieron con el objetivo de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo de cada una, son de una zona bastante alejada del centro, que aun esa en crecimiento, eminentemente rural.
Una de las integrantes la señora Anunciación quien se dedica a producir y vender productos agrícolas en su huerta, y por medio de ello tiene los ingresos mínimos que necesita para poder dar a su familia lo básico para tener una vida sin necesidades. El crédito que solicita lo quiere invertir en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y a la compra de algunos productos agrícolas y los vende en su propia casa, abasteciendo así toda su comunidad.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo bastante unido, con  la  plena convicción de trabajar todas juntas, apoyándose mutuamente en pos de fortalecer el emprendedurismo de cada una y así facilitar una mejor calidad de vida para sí mismas como para la familia.
texts.en:
The group called "Nueva Esperanza" [New Hope] is in its first cycle with thirteen members.  These women meet with the objective to help their families by working.  They are from an area that is very far from the city center, and although their town is growing, it is still predominantly rural.  

The featured member is Anunciación.  She makes a living harvesting and selling produce that she grows in her orchard.  Through this business, she has the minimal income required to provide basic items for her family.  

She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of farming supplies, fertilizers, and several agricultural products so that she can then sell her produce from her own home, thereby supplying the entire community.

The members have formed a very united group.  Their plan is to work all together, mutually supporting and strengthening one another.  This will allow them to improve the quality of life for each member and their families.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, fertilizers, and several agricultural products.

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: Monsieur Assane est un homme de 60 ans qui s’active depuis plus de 20 ans. Il est marie et père de famille. Il fait du petit commerce en vendant du sucre. Monsieur Assane fait parti des premiers clients de ce guichet de l’IMCEC mais n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit. Son commerce n’était pas aussi développé que cela. La, il a tout juste besoin de 50000F CFA pour acheter du sucre et revendre. C’est grâce aux bénéfices, il peut régler les petits besoins de sa famille. Avec l’activité, cela lui permet de s’occuper part rapport a son âge. Son souci majeur est de voire ses enfants un jour être indépendant et prendre la relève dans les charges de la maison comme cela il pourra prendre sa retraite.
texts.en: Mister Assane is a 60 year old man who has been active in business for more than 20 years. He is married and a father. He has a small shop selling sugar. Mister Assane is part of the first clients of this branch of the UIMCEC but has never benefited from a loan. His business was not as developed as this. Today, he needs just 50,000 FCFA to buy sugar and resell. It's thanks to the profits, that he will be able to take care of the small needs of his family. The business allows him to be busy with respect to his age. His major concern is to see his children be independent one day and takeover the responsibilities of the home. In this way he will be able to retire.

loans.use: to buy sugar to resell.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El comité San Expedito están en el 5to Ciclo con 15  integrantes, son de la ciudad de Santaní, una ciudad muy alejada, que esta en vías de desarrollo, tienen muy escaso acceso a los medios de comunicación.
Una de las integrantes la señora Juana quien se dedica a criar animales de corral y a venderlos, como ser gallinas, cerdos, y demás. Cuenta que está esforzándose por salir adelante y quiere que su familia pueda tener todo lo que ella no pudo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados, maíz para cría y engorde de sus animales y los vende desde su propia casa. Ella es una señora muy emprendedora que día a día aporta su compañerismo e incita a las compañeras a trabajar de manera solidaria.
texts.en:
The group San Expedito is in its fifth cycle and has fifteen group members.  The members are from the city of Santaní, a city that is far away and in the stages of development.  They have very limited access to media and communication.  

The featured group member is Juana, who makes a living raising and selling farm animals, like chickens, pigs, and others.  She says that this work strengthens her in moving forward, and that she wants her family to be able to have everything that she could not.

She is requesting a loan to buy animal food, including a type of corn to feed and fatten her animals so that she can then sell them from her home.  She is a very enterprising woman with a lot of team spirit.  She always encourages her group members to work in a united way.

loans.use: to buy animal food, including a type of corn to feed and fatten her animals.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 45 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 12 years and 26 years old. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She was in this business before she got married and sells soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits to her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is lack of capital to expand.

Emma requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business more than ever. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale

loans.name: Alusine H. Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school located in Wellington, in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They have come to SMT,  a local partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 12,500,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones). With the help of this loan, they are going to buy or invest in things that their mere salaries could not let them buy or invest in. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Alusine is the featured leader of this team of teachers. Born in northern Sierra Leone, Alusine is married to a trader, and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Alusine has been a schoolteacher for eight years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: San Isidro 2 Group

texts.es:
San Isidro 2 está en su Primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 de las 13 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir trabajando para poder mejorar su economía.
La Sra. Narcisa, es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de gallinas, es un trabajo muy sacrificado ya que debe estar siempre pendiente de sus animales, de que no les falte nada. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora, quien quiere ir mejorando su trabajo poco a poco y por medio de su esfuerzo.
Con su crédito quiere comprar  en mayor cantidad de gallinas para la cría y venta, y de esa forma seguir invirtiendo en su plan de negocios y dar a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The women's group "San Isidro 2" is in its first loan cycle.  All the women have promised to work and to help one another get ahead.  They are part of the poverty elimination program, and four out of thirteen women in the group are living below the poverty line.  They continue working in order to be able to improve the economy.

The featured member is Narcisa, and she makes a living selling chickens.  It is a very demanding job because she always needs to keep an eye on her animals to ensure that they are healthy.  She is a very fighting woman, and she wants to continue improving her business, little by little, through her efforts.

With the loan, she will buy a large quantity of chickens to raise and later sell.  In this way, she will continue investing in her business and being able to  give her family what they need.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Rugiatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children aged 14 years and 27 years old. One of her children is going to school. After the war, Rugiatu established her wax cotton business. She began her business because she needed to earn income to support her home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run it.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy more wax cotton for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Rugiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton for resale.

loans.name: Sabanor United Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sabanor United” group. They are small-scale business people based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently, improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Rugiatu. Rugiatu is age 31; she was born in Roronk village. She is married to a trader, and the couple has five children: three in primary school, one in secondary school and one is not of school-going age. 

Rugiatu sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil). With the help of this loan, she is going to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Opporunity Women Group

texts.en:
Alice is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alice was born in Bo city, in southern Sierra Leone, 32 years ago. She is married to a mason, and the couple has one child who is attending primary school. Alice sells chickens and has been doing this business for eight years now.

With the help of this loan, Alice and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve on their living conditions. 

Alice will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL, or Sierra Leone leones) to buy a large quantity of chickens for resale.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of chickens for resale.

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en:
Mouena is 46 years old and single with four children. She wants to start a small business, making and selling German buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, oil, yeast, baking soda and a frying pan. 

In the future, Mouena hopes to buy an electric oven for her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, oil, yeast, baking soda and a frying pan.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Memunatu is 47 years old and married, with 3 children in the age group 9-13 years.  She runs a local basket business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone.  She started this business to make a daily living. 

She got into this business just after she got married, and sells baskets within her community. She says that sometimes business is very slow.

Memunatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more baskets for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to expand her business.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more baskets for resale.

loans.name: Ya Sailay

texts.en:
Ya’ Sailay is 48 years old and widowed with 3 children. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business, selling fish within her community, just after she got married to earn a daily living. She says that at present her business is doing well, because she has been able to take care of her family out of her profit.

Ya’ Sailay requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Sainor Group

texts.en:
Maseray is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Maseray was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone, 34 years ago. She is married to a trader, and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively. Maseray sells onions and has been doing this business for two years now.

With the help of this loan, Maseray and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve on their living conditions. Maseray will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL, or Sierra Leone leones) to buy bags of onions to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy bags of onions to add to her current stock.

loans.name: We The Woman Dem01 Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “We The Woman Dem” group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve on their living conditions. 

Salaymatu is the featured leader of this group. The 47-year-old is married to a building contractor, and they have two children who are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively. Salaymatu has been a businesswoman for seven years now; she sells used clothes. With her share of this loan, she will buy a bale of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Short Street Strickers Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Short Street Strickers” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 2,000,000.00 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Zainab is the featured leader of this group. Zainab is a 36-year-old; she is married with three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Zainab sells clothes and has been doing this business for six years now. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy a bale of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Abdulatif

texts.ru: Абдулатиф трудолюбивый и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 44 лет. Он женат и имеет на иждивении 3 детей. С малых лет Абдулатиф занимался  земледелием и животноводством, он помогал своему отцу и вот сейчас он самостоятельно ведёт свой бизнес. С помощью  своей семьи  он занимается посевом картофеля  и получает  доход на ежедневные расходы семьи. Абдулатиф уже давно сотрудничает с Арванд. Он получал кредит, для того чтобы начать своё дело. И по сей день он пытается расширять свой бизнес, чтобы получать от этого больше дохода, которого будет хватать на все нужды его семьи. Абдулатиф и его жена имеют мечту вырастить своих детей хорошими и образованными людьми, чтобы они также создали свои семьи,  нашли свой жизненный путь. Сейчас у Абдулатифа имеется несколько голов скота, которых он выращивает, но он хочет закупить ещё несколько голов скота. Для этого ему нужны денежные средства. Поэтому Абдулатиф обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdulatif is a hard-working and a cheerful man of 44 years.  He is married and is raising three children.  From a very young age, Abdulatif  has been farming and raising cattle.  He used to help his father in this business, and now, he is doing it on his own.  With the help of his family, he cultivates potatoes and uses the income on everyday expenses of his family.

Abdulatif has been working with Arvand for a long time.  He had previously obtained a loan to start his business.  Since then, he has been trying to expand his enterprise so he could generate more profit, and use it to provide for all of the necessities of his family.  Abdulatif and his wife dream of raising their children to be good and educated people, so that one day, they could start their own families and find their own paths in life.  

Currently, Abdulatif is already raising a few heads of cattle, but he wishes to buy a few more.  To obtain the necessary financial means to purchase cattle, Abdulatif has applied for a loan to Arvand.  He thanks Arvand for their financial support, in advance.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: God Gee Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “God Gee” group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 3,000,000 (SLL 500,000 each). With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 
Aminata is the featured leader of this group. The 48-year-old is a widow with 2 children, who are attending secondary and tertiary academic institutions, respectively. Aminata has been a businesswoman for 30 years. She sells cassava-bread, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of cassavas and breads to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of cassavas and breads to add to her business.

loans.name: Les Compagnons De Jesus (1) Group

texts.en:
Gladis is one of the members of Les Compagnons de Jesus (1) Group. The group consists of six female micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. 

Gladis is married, with three children whose ages range from one to 11 years old. She is very excited to be receiving her second loan from HOPE Congo S.A. after having successfully paid off her previous loan. She has had her business for around four years, selling general goods to her community. 

With this next loan she will be able to buy more salted fish which has been selling really well lately. She says her strategy is to begin to specialize in just a few items rather than selling everything. 

She hopes to, one day, be a wholesale seller of fish! Gladis has big dreams for the future of her family. She hopes that, one day, she will be able to pay for all of her children to get a quality education. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to pay for salted fish to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Esperanza está trabajando y con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, son 21 mujeres que están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer en qué situación esta cada una de ellas. 
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Lorenza, quien se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella por medio de su esfuerzo y su lucha diaria muestra que trabajando es la única forma en la que se puede salir adelante y ayudar así a sus seres queridos. Ella ve una gran oportunidad en el programa de comité de mujeres, y es por eso que forma parte de este desafío.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras frescas para la venta, como ser tomates, locotes, cebollas, y demás verduras, y así seguir invirtiendo en su microemprendimiento y también ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) group is working and, with great effort, is getting ahead. They are 21 women who are completing the elimination of poverty survey to be able to understand what situation each of them is in.

One person worthy of highlighting is Señora Lorenza, who works in vegetable sales. Through her efforts and daily struggle she shows that working is the only way one can get ahead and thus help one’s loved ones. She sees a great opportunity in the women’s committee program, and it is because of this that she joined this challenge.

Today she is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fresh vegetables to sell, such as tomatoes, green peppers, onions, and other vegetables, and thus to keep investing in her microenterprise and to help her family as well.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, onions, and others, to sell.

loans.name: Honest Debt I Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Honest Debt I” group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 2,500,000 SLL (500,000 SLL each). With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group. Kadiatu sells charcoal.  She has been doing this business for many years.  She has requested this loan in order to buy bags of charcoal to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is not far from Masai land. He has two children and he has been doing this farming work for six years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

Walter stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Source of income for his household needs." His biggest challenge is: "Lack of market." Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Walter was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Unlike other microfinance institutions, it has better customer service." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "It helps us improve our lives."

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked: "How will this loan benefit his family?," Walter replied: "Improved living standard."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Walter owns the following: 'cow and poultry,' but he does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile.' 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net and sewing machine,' but he does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, TV, or DVD.'

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas tiene 34 años, está casada con Melquíades y tiene solo 1 hijo con quien vive en su casa propia. Felicitas se se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en su domicilio ya que no había muchos negocios de este rubro en su localidad. Se inicio con poca mercadería y con mucho temor de no llegar a recuperar el dinero que había invertido hasta ese entonces, pero afortunadamente durante los primeros meses le fue bien y logró entonces consolidarse en su negocio de a pocos. Ofrece actualmente diversos productos de primera necesidad tales como verduras, cereales y bebidas de diversos tipos. Suele comprar su mercadería al por mayor ya que le permite asegurar el abastecimiento de su negocio por mayor tiempo y también obtenerlos a precios bajos. Entre sus principales clientes están sus vecinos y amigos que visitan su negocio por el buen trato que les brinda.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con Kivay espera contar con la confianza necesaria ya que lo consideraría una gran ayuda para seguir con su negocio. En está oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 soles para la compra de productos tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 34 years old and married to Melquíades with whom she has a son. They live in their own house. Felicitas earns her living selling groceries from her home as there aren’t many of this kind of business in her neighbourhood. She started out with very little stock and a lot of fear that she would lose her money, but fortunately all went well in the first months and she gradually managed to build a good business.

Felicitas currently offers a good range of basics such as vegetables, cereals, and all kinds of drinks. She generally buys the merchandise at wholesale prices as that allows her to have a well-stocked store most of the time, and she also benefits from lower prices. Her main customers are her neighbours and friends who frequent her store for the good service she provides.

This is Felicitas’s first loan with Kiva. She hopes that people will trust her as the money will be a great help with the business. She is seeking 3,000 soles to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk etc.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as sugar, rice, milk etc.

loans.name: Khasan

texts.ru: Хасан добродушный мужчина в возрасте 55 лет. Он женат и имеет 3 сыновей. Со своей семьёй Хасан живут в сельской местности, ближе к горам. Живя в сельской местности, Хасан уже с самого детства освоил животноводство. Он помогал своему отцу ухаживать и пасти скот.  Он очень любит скот и на сегодня имеет большой опыт в этом деле. Хасан, начиная с 2006 года сотрудничает с Арванд.  Он является добросовестным клиентом, который своевременно погашает свои обязательства.  В настоящее время Хасан выращивает крупно- рогатый скот, а затем продаёт на мясо и молоко, полученное от этого скота на местном рынке. Занимаясь этим видом бизнеса Хасан хочет получать хороший стабильный доход. Он недавно женил своего старшего сына, и все накопленные сбережения от своего бизнеса, ему пришлось потратить на организацию свадебного мероприятия сына. Но сейчас Хасан хочет вновь закупить несколько голов скота, чтобы ещё больше расширить свой бизнес. Поэтому Хасан обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота, для расширения своего бизнеса. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Khasan is a good natured man at the age of 55.  He is married and has three sons.  Together with his family, Khasan lives in the countryside, near the mountains.  Growing up among farmlands, Khasan became an expert in raising livestock.  He used to help his father with the care and feeding of the cattle.  He loves to raise cattle and today, he has a lot of experience in this line of work.

Khasan has been working with Arvand from 2006.  He is a very responsible client who pays all of his dues on time.  Currently, Khasan is raising cattle and sells their meat and milk at the local market.  Khasan wants to develop his business to become a stable source of income.  Recently, he married off his oldest son, and had to spend all of his savings on organizing the wedding celebration.  

Today, Khasan wants to purchase additional cattle and to advance his business forward.  He is applying for a loan to Arvand to buy cattle and to expand his herd.  He is hoping for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand, in advance, for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh (1) Group

texts.en:
Marie is one of the members of the group Jehovah Jireh (1). The group consists of three female micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. 

Marie is a single mother of four children whose ages range from 17 to 34 years old. She is very excited to be receiving her fourth loan from HOPE Congo after having successfully paid off her previous loans. She has had her business for around six years, selling general goods to her community. She says her biggest challenge so far has been finding the ideal location for her business to maximize her exposure to potential clients. With this next loan, she will be able to buy more items to further grow her inventory. By buying in bulk, she will be able to reduce her prices, giving her a competitive advantage in her bustling market. 

Marie has big dreams for the future of her family. She hopes that one day all of her children can join in her business and hopes to expand to a hardware store and supermarket. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to pay for imported drinks, clothes, and utensils.

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh (2) Group

texts.en:
Charlotte is one of the members of the group Jehovah Jireh (2). The group consists of four female micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. 

Charlotte is married with six children whose ages range from 14 to 33 years old. She is very excited to be receiving her fourth loan from HOPE Congo after having successfully paid off her previous loans. She has had her business for around seven years. Her business consists of selling clothing and kitchenware. With this next loan she will be able to buy more of each of these items to further grow her inventory. By buying in bulk, she will be able to reduce her prices, giving her a competitive advantage in her bustling market. 

Charlotte has big dreams for the future of her family. She hopes that one day she will be able to pay for a plot of land and then build a house. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to pay for neckties, large pots, and fabric.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso tiene 35 años, esta casado con Edith y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia hecha de madera. Desde muy joven aprendió la humilde labor del campo y  que se debe emplear para obtener una buena producción de cacao gracias a que fue siempre partícipe de las actividades ancestrales de sus padres en el campo. Es así como desde hace más de 16 años con terrenos de sus padres le cedieron inició su trabajo y viene formándose como un buen productor de cacao en la zona. Para culminar las tareas rutinarias de sus terrenos convoca a trabajadores del lugar quienes son muy dedicados a las labores agrícolas y se sienten a gusto con el trabajo que desempeñan logrando una buena campaña. Desea contar con capital suficiente que le permita iniciar la campaña productiva con todo lo necesario, para ello debe contar con  dinero para la contrata de jornaleros y abono orgánico. Este es su primer préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y desea contar con la confianza necesaria para ampliar su producción. En está ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de un pequeño terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 35, married to Edith, and the couple lives in their own wooden home with their two children. 

Alfonso always took part in his parents' labors in the fields, so he learned at a very young age to do the humble field work required to achieve good cacao production. For over 16 years, Alfonso has used this experience to start his own farm on land his parents' left him and has become a top regional producer of cacao. 

To ensure all of the routine farm work is done, Alfonso hires laborers who are very dedicated to their work and enjoy contributing to a successful season. Alfonso hopes to have sufficient capital to start a productive season with everything he needs, so he needs funds to hire workers and purchase organic manure. This is the first loan Alfonso is applying for from financial institution, and he believes it will provide him with the funds he needs to boost production. Alfonso is applying for 3,000 new soles for the purchase of a small plot of farmland.

loans.use: To purchase farmland.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia 2 Group

texts.es:
Sagrada Familia 2 está en su tercer ciclo, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder medir las condiciones de vida de las integrantes, donde 5 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Liliana es parte de este grupo, quien se dedica a la venta de variadas prendas, comenta que al principio le fue muy difícil, pero con la confianza y la lucha está mejorando y saliendo adelante. Hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela, que cada cierto tiempo compra de ella.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, como ser remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones y demás, y así seguir con su trabajo y luchando por superar su pobreza.
texts.en:
Sagrada Familia 2 is in its third cycle, and its members are doing the poverty eradication survey in order to measure their living conditions. It turns out that five of them live below the poverty line.

Liliana is a member of this group, and makes a living selling various items of clothing. She explains that at the beginning it was hard, but with confidence and hard work things are improving and she is moving forwards. Today, she has a very good customer base, who buy from her every once in a while.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying clothes, such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, trousers and other items, and in this way, continue working and fighting to overcome her poverty.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, trousers and other items.

loans.name: Volonte Divine (2) Group

texts.en:
Aime is one of the members of Volonte Divine (2) Group. The group consists of five micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. 

Aime is married, with five children, whose ages range from two to 32 years old. Aime is very excited to be receiving his third loan from HOPE Congo S.A. after having successfully paid off his previous loans. He has had his business for around 12 years. He owns a butcher shop where he sells all types of meat, from beef to fish. 

With this next loan, Aime will be able to buy more of each type of meat he sells. By buying in bulk, he will be able to sell his meat at a lower price than his competition. 

Aime hopes to continue to grow and provide the freshest meat in his community! With future profits, he dreams of, one day, starting a large garden for his family as well as to provide better education for his children. He thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to pay for chicken, beef, pork, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Bana Na Nzambe 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Jeanne is one of the members of Bana Na Nzambe 2 (1) Group. The group consists of five female micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. 

Jeanne is a single mother of three children, whose ages range from 19 to 30 years old. She is very excited to be receiving her fifth loan from HOPE Congo S.A. after having successfully paid off her previous loans. 

She has had her business for around 20 years. Her business consists of selling all types of used clothing. She says her biggest challenge, so far, is the sudden changes in prices from her suppliers and the seasonality of their stock. 

With this next loan, Jeanne will be able to buy more of each of these items to increase her inventory. By buying in bulk, she will be able to protect herself against price changes and future shortages in stock from her suppliers. 

Jeanne has big dreams for the future of her family. She hopes that, one day, she will be able to build a new home and buy a car. She also hopes to pay for the technical business training of all her children. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy used clothing in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Here is Miatta who is trying to make her life better by engaging in business. She explains that she started her business in order to improve her living conditions. She was not lucky enough to finish 11th grade, and presently she has 4 children aged between 5 and 14. Only three are in school and they all live at home. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the more populous communities in Montserrado due to some factors like good roads, quietness, and affordable rents. 

She has been selling washing soap, chloride, bluing, etc. for ten years now in the local market. One of her main challenges is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more washing soap, chloride, bluing, etc. for her business. She hopes to own a house and move from a table top business to a shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more washing soap, chloride, bluing, etc. for her business

loans.name: Bana Na Nzambe 2 (2) Group

texts.en: Ernestine is one of the members of the group Bana Na Nzambe 2 (2). The group consists of five micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Ernestine is married with nine children whose ages range from 16 to 35 years old. She is very excited to be receiving her fifth loan from HOPE Congo after having successfully paid off her previous loans. She has had her business for around 28 years. Her business consists of selling auto parts and supplies. With this next loan she plans to buy more brake fluid, which is very much needed by the many taxis in Brazzaville. One of her strategies in her business has been selling in bulk to owners of multiple taxis. With these regular customers, there is less risk of having a bad month of sales. With future profits Ernestine hopes to further diversify her inventory as well as construct a new home for her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy brake fluid

loans.name: Hassanatu

texts.en:
Hassanatu is 35 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 2 and 15 years. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo, a  western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She got into this business after the war, and sells glass cups, knifes and food containers with her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is the location.

Hassanatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone, to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business, and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop.  She is grateful for your support.
