After graduating from junior high school, Linda decided to set up her own ‘banku'-selling business (banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish, consistent paste) as well as preparing other dishes for sale. She prepares her banku on her own and proceeds to sell it in Hotopo (near Takoradi). 

With over seven years of experience, she is currently looking to further expand her enterprise. Unfortunately, she is limited, due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize and cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty banku. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a driver) with the upkeep of their house, while ensuring that their five children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more maize and cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty banku.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Cecilia is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling ripe plantains, potatoes and vegetables in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for a while now. Cecilia is married and has two children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Cecilia will use the loan to purchase more ripe plantains, potatoes and vegetables to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more ripe plantain, potatoes and vegetables to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married with four children. She has received some schooling up to finishing middle school. Currently, Mary produces and sells soap in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about five years now. Her husband is a farmer. Mary’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Mary will use the loan to increase her existing soap production capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Mary plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing soap production capacity

loans.name: Lemau

texts.en: Lemau is 32 years old and married with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling rice and curry in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of rice, boxes of chicken, onion, salt, sacks of flour, curry, garlic, onion and dripping oil. In the future, Lemau hopes to earn more from her business to help her family and her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, boxes of chicken, onion,salt, sacks of flour, curry, garlic, onion and dripping oil

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica sells provisions in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been educated up to finishing middle school. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Veronica has been working in this enterprise for four years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock of provisions. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her provisions enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock of provisions for her store.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is single and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Akua is a successful businesswoman. She sells coconut oil and is also a food vendor in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about 11 years. Akua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Akua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of coconut to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of coconuts to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business.

Marivic has been in this business for five years and also earns income from meat vending.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria  es una mujer soltera de 20  años de edad, quien vive junto a su hijo de 9 meses en el  Departamento de Sololá. 
Es una persona amable y sobre todo trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de artesanías  como pulseras, collares, rosarios  y anillos. Ella inicio esta actividad desde pequeña ya que su madre le enseño a como realizar esta labor,  que hasta el momento ha sido bastante productiva porque se pueden hacer diferentes diseños.
Ahora cuenta con varios años de experiencia en esta actividad que le ha generado ingresos y ganancias aceptables que han podido cubrir los diferentes gastos de su familia. Por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de materiales como piedras, hilos y broches para poder elaborar más diseños y así ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es tener un local para poder comercializar por mayor su producto y de esta manera mejorar la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a single woman, 20 years old, who lives with her 9-month-old son in the Department of Sololá. 

She is a likeable and above all hard-working person. She works making and selling handicrafts such as bracelets, necklaces, rosaries and rings. She started this activity when she was small, since her mother taught her how to do this work, which has been quite productive, since a variety of designs can be made. 

Now she has quite a few years of experience with this work, which has generated acceptable income and earnings, so that she has been able to cover the various expenses of her family. Because of this, she is currently requesting a loan of Q 5,000.00 to buy supplies such as stones, wire and brooches, so she can create more designs and thus offer better service to her customers. 

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her products on a wholesale basis and thus improve her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is a 21-year-old woman, with two children. She wants to start a small business, making and selling barbeque and pancakes in her community. 

To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, dripping oil, yeast, soy sauce, sausages, and tomato sauce. 

In the future, Carolyn hopes to extend her business. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, dripping oil, yeast, soy sauce, sausages, and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Jafete

texts.pt:
Jafete, casado, pai de 6 filhos, dos quais 2 é que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua sobrinha que vive com ele. 
É alfaiate (confecciona e vende vestuário diverso) há mais de vinte anos. Também é pastor evangélico de profissão.
Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais tecidos para confecção de vestuário a fim de responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos ampliar a alfaiataria e melhora a a produtividade, abrir uma machamba para agricultura comercial e criar pequenas espécies. Os principais desafios são: associar o tempo de trabalho da alfaiataria e igreja devendo trabalhar a noite no sentido de satisfazer os pedidos e a falta de fundos para aplicar na agricultura.
texts.en:
Jafete is married and has six children, two of whom attend different school grades. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family he also supports his niece who lives with him.
He has been a tailor (he makes and sells various garments) for over 20 years. He's also an evangelical preacher by trade.
With the current loan for 20,000mt he intends to purchase more fabric for making clothes so he can meet the demand by stocking up.
His dreams are to enlarge his shop, improve his productivity and set up a farm for commercial farming and for raising small animals. His main challenges are combining the time he has for his tailoring and his clerical work - he needs to work at night in order to meet the orders - and the lack of funds to invest in farming.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric for making clothes so he can meet the demand by stocking up.

loans.name: Salvador Marcos

texts.pt:
Salvador é militar, casado e pai de 9 filhos dos quais 4 ainda sob sua responsabilidade e vive numa casa cedida pelo serviço tem 54 anos de idade.
Com o dinheiro do empréstimo pretende comprar de chapas de zinco, varões, cimento para dar continuidade a construção de sua casa.
No futuro espera fazer uma mercearia onde poderá  vender produtos de 1ª necessidade o que irá reforçar sua renda familiar e também servir de reforma.
Diz que seu desafio e pagar pontualmente o emprestimo e garantiar a escolaridade de seus filhos.
texts.en:
Salvador is a serviceman. He's married and has nine children, four of whom are still under his responsibility. He lives in military housing and he's 54 years old.
With the money from the loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets and rods) so he can continue building his house.
In the future he hopes to set up a grocery store where he can sell products that are household staples. This will increase his family's income and also serve renovation purposes.
He states that his challenge is repaying the loan in a timely fashion and ensuring his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets and rods) so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Agnes did not have access to any formal education yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Agnes prepares and sells provisions for a living. She normally sells her provisions in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been doing so for about five years. Agnes is married and has seven children, Due to the fact that her husband is unemployed; Agnes uses all her income to feed and provide for her entire family. She will use the loan to purchase more provisions to improve her overall sales. Agnes wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more provision to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Julliet

texts.en: Julliet is involved in selling provisions in Hotopo (near Takoradi). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband, a building contractor, support their two children. She has been selling provisions for five years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase more provisions to increase sales. She aspires to use her profits to both better market her provisions enterprise and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to increase sales

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells soft drinks in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been educated until the end of junior high school. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. 

Grace has been working in this enterprise for five years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels of soft drinks. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her soft drink enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of soft drinks.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila tiene 52 años, es divorciada y vive en su casa construida con bloques de adobe junto al último de sus hijos. Se inicio desde que tuvo 20 años en las labores agrícolas junto a su esposo con quien logró adquirir un terreno de media hectárea y cultivar varios árboles de cacao orgánico así como café; entre otros.
Tras el primer año de trabajo le fue posible obtener sus primeras ganancias iniciándose así como una productora y trabajando en beneficio de su pequeña familia. Tras varios años de trabajo al lado de su esposo se separó por motivos de fuerza mayor y se vio obligada a mantener económicamente a su familia de manera independiente. Actualmente cuenta con 2 hectáreas de cultivo donde expandió sus plantaciones de cacao y árboles frutales. Tiene el orgullo de haber sacado adelante a sus hijos mayores quienes hoy son personas independientes y muy trabajadoras. Para el normal desempeño de sus labores acostumbra a contar con los insumos necesarios tales como abonos y herramientas para brindarle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus diversas plantaciones. Uno de sus principales objetivos es seguir trabajando con la motivación que la caracteriza para apoyar a su último hijo en sus estudios superiores y mejorar su vivienda. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y espera contar con su apoyo para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para comprar herramientas que faciliten su trabajo tales como machetes, tijeras de podar, entre otros.
texts.en: Cirila, 52, is divorced and lives in a house built from adobe bricks, along with her youngest child. She has been working in agriculture since she was 20 years old alongside her husband, with whom she was able to acquire half a hectare of land and grow several organic cacao trees as well as coffee, among other things. After the first year of work, she was able to earn her first income, starting out as a producer and working to benefit her small family. After several years of working with her husband, they separated due to exceptional circumstances, and she had to support her family by herself. Currently she has two hectares of crops where she expanded her cacao plantings and fruit trees. She is proud of having advanced her older children, who today are independent and very hardworking. For carrying out her work day to day, she is used to having the necessary supplies like fertilizers and tools to adequately care for her assorted crops. One of her main goals is to continue working with her characteristic motivation to support her youngest son in his higher education and improve her home. This is her first loan with Kiva and she hopes to have their support to move forward. She also promises to make her payments on time. On this occasion, she hopes to receive 500 new soles to buy tools to make her work easier, like machetes and pruning shears, among others.

loans.use: to buy harvesting tools

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas tiene 33 años, es madre soltera de 2 pequeños hijos con quienes vive en su casa hecha de adobe. Felicitas se dedica a la agricultura en un terreno de una hectárea y media que le cedieron sus padres ya que no contaba con un sustento económico mara mantener sus hijos. Tras 15 años de experiencia en el rubro ha logrado consolidarlo como su principal sustento económico. Inicialmente contaba con el apoyo de su esposo pero tras su separación cuenta con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar, a quienes contrata para las labores complicadas tales como el retiro de maleza y aplicación de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo. Posee una cantidad considerable de árboles cacaoteros que le permiten obtener buenas ganancias al finalizar la respectiva campaña productiva. La parte que mas le agrada de su labor es partir las mazorcas y extraer las almendras de cacao que son secadas de manera artesanal y llevadas posteriormente hasta la capital de su distrito donde obtiene buenos precios por la venta de sus productos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Felicitas is 33 years old and she is the single mother of two small children who live with her in her adobe home.  Felicitas farms for a living on a hectare and a half of land that her parents gave her because she did not have the financial resources to take care of her children.  After 15 years in the field, she has been able to consolidate it as her main source of income.  At first she had the help of her husband, but since their separation she has relied on the help of workers from the area whom she hires for complicated jobs, such as clearing weeds and applying organic fertilizer to her crops.  She has a considerable amount of cacao trees that provide her with good profits at the end of their planting season.  The part she likes most about her work is splitting the pods and extracting the cacao nibs, which are dried by hand and then taken to the capital of her district where she gets good prices for her produce.  This is her first loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the financial support she has received to get ahead.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  She currently needs 1,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. Estrella is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Estrella requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Estrella has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married to a driver and has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as to save for a rainy day. As a junior high school graduate, Margaret currently sells coconut sweets and pastries in Hotopo (near Takoradi).  Margaret sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more coconut sweets and pastries, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Margaret wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her coconut sweets and pastries business

loans.use: to buy more coconut sweets and pastries, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua operates a provisions business in Hotopo (near Takoradi). Akosua is divorced with three children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Akosua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Akosua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of gari, sugar, and milo in a provisions store, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. Akosua received some education in middle school, hence she understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, and she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of gari, sugar, and milo in a provisions store, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is divorced and has four children. After primary level education, Gloria is now an established businesswoman. She is a hairdresser in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about twenty years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Gloria uses her income to provide for the entire family. Gloria will use the loan to expand her business, thus aiding her to improve her customer demand. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gloria plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to expand her business, thus aiding her to improve her customer demand

loans.name: Arlindo Lucas

texts.pt:
Arlindo  é casado e pai de 4 filhos que frequentam o nίvel  primário e secundário vive na casa própria sustenta alem da famίlia 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele. É bibliotecário ha 13 anos  e trabalha 8 horas diárias e durante os fins de semana presta serviços como electrecista.
Com o valor do crédito ira comprar varrões, cimento, areia para dar continuidade a construção de sua casa .
Tem como plano expandir a prestação de seus serviços como electricista.
Compromete se a pagar o empréstimo pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais para cocretizar seus projectos.
texts.en:
Arlindo is married and has four children who attend elementary and high school. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family he also supports two nephews who live with him. He has been a librarian for over 13 years and works 8 hours a day. On weekends he provides services as an electrician.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase rods, cement and sand so he can continue building his house.
His plan is to expand his electrician services.
He pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion and apply for more loans again so he can accomplish his projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, rods and sand) so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Freddy Ramón

texts.es:
Don Freddy Ramón es un señor de 53 años que habita en la comarca Los Tololos ubicada a 5 kilómetros del municipio de El Sauce.
Desde hace seis años labora como operario de limpieza para una empresa de dicho municipio donde su trabajo principal es barrer las calles principales con el fin de ver una ciudad más limpia y sana.
Don Freddy a pesar de su edad ejerce su labor con dedicación y a pesar de vivir alejado del municipio porque le toca levantarse a las cuatro de la mañana y viajar en bicicleta para iniciar su labor a las cinco de la mañana.
Últimamente se ha sentido mal de salud y por falta de recursos no ha visitado un médico porque su salario apenas alcanza para sobrevivir, por este motivo se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento con fondos Kiva que sabe que es una organización que apoya a personas de escasos recursos.
Con este crédito pretende comprar medicamentos y realizarse una serie de exámenes para combatir su malestar.
Tiene la esperanza en el señor y en estas personas que apoyarán su solicitud donde les quedará eternamente agradecido.
texts.en: Freddy Ramón is a 53-year-old man who lives in the Los Tololos region, located five kilometers from the municipality of El Sauce. For six years, he has worked operating a cleaning machine for a business in said municipality, where his main job is to sweep the main streets in order to see a cleaner and healthier city. In spite of his age, Freddy works with dedication and this is despite living far from the city, because he has to get up at four in the morning and travel by bicycle to start his job at five am. Lately, he hasn't been feeling well, and due to a lack of resources, he has not visited a doctor, because his salary is barely enough to survive on. This is why he came to the Ceprodel office in search of financing with funds from Kiva, which he knows is an organization that supports people with scarce resources. With this loan, he intends to buy medicines and undergo a series of exams to fight his ill health. He has hope in God and in those people who will support his request, to whom he will remain eternally grateful.

loans.use: to buy medicines and get medical exams

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 55-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

For many years, her son has been manufacturing plastic accessories, such as toys and plastic accessories for household usage, through an injection-molding machine. His practice is to buy crushed plastic raw material from the market and put it into the electric injection-molding machine. The raw material becomes melted under high temperature and then it is injected into the dies through compression, giving it specific shape. In this way, Parveen's son manufactures the accessories on demand and makes enough income to contribute to her family's livelihood. 

Her son operates two different kinds of compression machines, but one of them goes out of order. He wants to fix the problem and wants to buy crushed plastic raw material. Therefore, Parveen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he could fix the problem of his molding machine and could buy raw material, as well.

Parveen has eight children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide her children good food, health, and education. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan and, until this time, has been showing a good payment history. She expects a boost in her earnings and she wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of the business. Parveen is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of her son's molding machine and to buy crushed plastic raw material in order to manufacture plastic accessories.

loans.name: Luis Ramon

texts.es:
Luis de 63 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, todos independientes. Por las condiciones económicas de su familia en aquel tiempo no pudo estudiar, ademas trabajaba la tierra para ayudar a su familia, actualmente vive con su esposa y una nieta.

Todavía es agricultor, tiene sembrado 14,000 mts cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 de frijol, se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para caminar un kilómetro hasta llegar al lugar donde tiene sembrado, realiza el trabajo del día y luego se queda cuidando el ganado.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas,para sembrar 7,000 mts cuadrados de maíz. 

Luis espera con el tiempo poder comprar 4 vacas lecheras, para vender mas leche y mejorar las candiciones de la familia con esos ingresos generados.
texts.en:
Sixty-three-year-old Luis is married and has four children, all of whom are independent.  Because of his family's financial situation, he was not able to go to school; instead he worked the land to help his family.  He currently lives with his wife and a granddaughter.  

He is still a farmer. He has 14,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 of beans. He gets up at five in the morning to walk a kilometer to the place where his crops are.  He does the day's work and then stays to look after the livestock.  

The loan will be used to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.  

Luis hopes that in time he will able to buy four dairy cows so he can sell more milk and improve conditions for his family with this income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education Helina is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling soap and provisions in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for a year now. Helina is married with a child. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their child's school fees. Helina wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell greater quantities of soap and provisions. In the long term, Helina plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell greater quantities of soap and provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement and bricks) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Lucia Silva

texts.pt:
Lucia é mãe solteira de 1 filho, tem 25 anos de idade  e é comerciante.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cerveja, refrescos, bolachas, vinhos, leite, massas, omo para dar continuidade ao seu negócio.
Tem como plano dar continuidade ao seu negocio aumentando o volume de mercadoria para o seu auto sustento.
No futuro pretende ampliar e terminar o seu emprestimo e voltar a solicitar mais.
texts.en:
Lucia is a single mother. She's 25 years old and has a son. She's a vendor.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase beer, refreshments, crackers, wine, milk, noodles and laundry detergent so she can keep her business afloat.
She plans to keep her business afloat by stocking up on merchandise so she can support herself.
In the future she intends to finish repaying her loan and apply for more loans again.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (cooking oil, refreshments, beverages, rice and laundry detergent) so she can increase turnover in her store.

loans.name: María Betzabé

texts.es:
María Betzabé es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, un poblado ubicado al occidente de Nicaragua y a pesar de quedar tan alejado de la capital doña Betzabé se siente muy orgullosa de ser parte de esta pequeña tierra y de ser pinolera.
Ella tuvo una única hija a la cual le ha tratado de dar la mejor educación con su salario de maestra de primaria ha sacado adelante a su hija.
Hoy acaba de terminar su carrera como Licenciada en Español por lo que viene el gasto de su promoción y tramitación del título para luego empezar a buscar empleo con el fin de ayudar  a su madre en los gastos del hogar.
Con este objetivo doña Betzabé se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento para cubrir estos gastos de promoción y del título de su hija, ya que se dio cuenta que los inversionistas de Kiva apoyan este tipo de gastos sobre todo a las familias de escasos recursos.
Espera y confía en Dios y en estas personas de buen corazón que apoyen su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión en la educación de su hija, ya que con su salario que es muy bajo no puede cubrir este tipo de gastos.
texts.en:
María Betzabé is from the municipality of El Sauce, a town located in west Nicaragua. Although she is quite far from the capital, she feels very proud to be a part of this little country and to be Nicaraguan.

She has just one daughter, for whom she has tried to provide the best education. With her salary as a primary school teacher she has helped her daughter meet this goal. Now she has just graduated with a degree in Spanish, which comes with the expenses of graduation and diploma processing to later begin looking for employment with the goal of helping her mother with household expenses.

With this objective, Maria came to the Ceprodel office in search of financing to cover the cost of her daughter's graduation and diploma. She realized that Kiva investors support this type of expense, especially for families with limited resources. She hopes and trusts in God and in these people of good heart that they will support her request to complete her investment in her daughter's education, since with her salary, which is very low, she is not able to cover this kind of expense.

loans.use: to cover graduation expenses and college diploma processing costs for her daughter.

loans.name: Maxon

texts.en:
Maxon is 28 years old. For the past two years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of KES 12,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his third loan, in the amount of KES 40,000 (Kenyan shillings). He is going to use the loan to service and repair his motorbike as well as purchase additional spare parts. He will use the profits to pay school fees for his niece as well as invest back into his business operations. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing his business, so that he will improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to repair, service and purchase spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mariza Albino

texts.pt:
Senhora Mariza é viúva e mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam nivel primário. vivem na casa própria. 

é negociante há mais de 4 anos,trabalha 9horas diárias e o resto do tempo dedica se aos filhos.Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar cimento,areia,barrotes, e chapas para mudar a cobertura da sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir min-mercearia visto que agora vende numa banca e tem um grande desafio que é de manter o sustento  escolar dos filhos.
texts.en:
Mariza is a widow and has four children who attend elementary school. They live in a house that she owns.
She has been a vendor for over four years. She works 9 hours a day and devotes the rest of her time to her children. With the money from the loan she'll purchase cement, sand, beams and metal sheets so she can change the roofing over her house.
In the future she intends to open a small grocery store, since she currently sells from a stall. Her biggest challenge is continuing to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement and metal sheets) in order to install roofing over her house.

loans.name: Karol Azucena

texts.es:
Karol de 28 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos de 10, 7 y 4 años de edad todos asisten a la escuela. Ella solo pudo estudiar hasta séptimo grado, su esposo es agricultor y ambos mantiene la familia.

Karol tiene cinco años de vender pupusas, comida rápida y refrescos, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre quien siempre a tenido una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, lugar donde Karol vende sus productos y se encuentra a unos 20 metros de donde vive. Diariamente Karol se despierta a las 5 de la mañana para preparar el desayuno de la familia, despachar a sus hijos y luego dedicarse al negocia en el que trabaja hasta las 7 de la noche.

El préstamo, será utilizado para construir un cafetín, comprara  800 ladrillos, 30 bolsas de cemento, 3 quintales de hierro, arena y  pagara mano de obra.  
Su sueño es ver a sus hijos con un titulo profesional, para que puedan defenderse en la vida, pero a corto plazo quiere construir un cafetín para trabajar propio.
texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Karol is married and has three children who are 10, 7, and 4 years old and all of whom are in school.  She was only able to study up until the 7th grade.  Her husband is a farmer and they both support their family.  

Karol has been selling pupusas, fast food, and soft drinks for five years.  She learned this business from her mother, who has always had a convenience store, which is where Karol sells her products.  It is located about 20 m from her home.  Karol gets up every day at five in the morning to make breakfast for her family, get her kids ready, and then start working at her business, where she stays until seven at night.  

The loan will be used to build a snack bar.  She will buy 800 bricks, 30 bags of cement, 3 quintals of iron, and sand, and she will pay for labor.  

Her dream is to see her children become licensed professionals so they can defend themselves in life, but for now she wants to build a snack stand for her work.

loans.use: to buy 800 bricks, 30 bags of cement, 3 quintals of iron, and sand, and to pay for labor to build a snack stand

loans.name: Liupapa

texts.en: Liupapa is a 32-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells pork cakes at Vailuutai Primary School and in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Liupapa needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, bags of flour, dripping oil, soy sauce and garlic onion. She plans to use her profits to save for family needs. Liupapa joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, flour, oil, soy sauce and garlic onions

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old and married.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 (Philippine pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like snack foods, dried fish, coffee, milk, cream, etc.

She has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an additional income from fishing.

Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like snack foods, dried fish, coffee, milk, cream, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Roger

texts.pt:
O Francisco é casado e pai de 6 filhos do quais 4 estudam no ensino primário e outros sem idade escolar
é professor há mais de 5 anos e também estudante universitário,sustenta sua familia e vive na casa própria,tem 33 anos de idade,trabalha 8 horas diárias.

Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar areia,cimento,vidros e pagar mão de obra para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende oficialisar o seu casamento,construir muro de vedação da sua casa,e terminar a faculdade. Diz que fará de tudo para reembolsar bem o empréstimo para garantir financiamentos subicequentes na hluvuku-adsema.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and has six children, four of whom attend elementary school and the rest of them haven't reached school age.
He has been a teacher for over five years. He's also a college student. He supports his family and lives in a house that he owns. He's 33 years old and works 8 hours a day.
With the money from the loan he'll purchase sand, cement and glass and he'll pay for labor so he can continue building his house.
In the future he intends to make his marriage official, build a surrounding wall around his house and finish college. He states that he'll do everything to repay the loan so he'll be guaranteed to get other loans from Hluvuku-Adsema.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (glass, sand, cement) and to pay for labor so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Karla Marianela

texts.es:
Karla de 20 años de edad, esta recién casada, no tiene hijos y solamente pudo estudiar hasta séptimo grado, su esposo trabaja en construcción como albañil con ellos vive la mamá de ella.

Desde muy pequeña, Karla se dedica al comercio, actividad que aprendió de su madre. Hoy en día Hace quesadillas de arroz, pan de torta y tamales de gallina, su producto lo vende en la zona, comenta que sus vecinos son sus mejores clientes y a veces tarda hasta 6 horas en terminar su venta.

El préstamo, será utilizado para comprar un quintal de hierro, 4 bolsas de cemento, 6 cuartones de madera, costaneras y una docena y media de laminas, lo demás para pagar mano de obra, ya que va a construir un techo para el horno donde hace sus quesadillas.

Como toda una mujer emprendedora, Karla en futuro quiere compra 4 vacas lecheras, para poder producir leche y venderla en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Karla, age 20, is newly married and has no children.  She was only able to go to school until the seventh grade.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  They live with her mother.

Karla has been in commerce ever since she was little.  She learned this business activity from her mother.  She now makes different types of sweet breads and chicken tamales.  She sells her products in the area.  She says that her neighbors are her best customers.  Sometimes it takes up to six hours to finish her sales. 

The loan will be used to buy a ‘quintal’ [one hundred pounds] of iron, four bags of cement, six planks of wood, rafters, and one and a half dozen zinc sheets.  The rest is to pay for labor.  She will build a roof for the oven where she makes the breads.

As a completely enterprising woman, Karla, in the future, wants to buy four dairy cows.  She will do this to be able to produce milk and sell it in the community.

loans.use: to buy construction material and pay for labor.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Cecilia is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling soap in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for seven years. 

Cecilia is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Cecilia will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of soap, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of soap, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ahlen Joy

texts.en:
Ahlen Joy is 22 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ahlen Joy has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. Ahlen Joy requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Ahlen Joy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ahlen Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school, Mary decided to set up her own pastries business in Fretsi (near Takoradi). With over three years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more pastries for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their five children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more pastries for resale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine has been married for thirty years and has three children. She is a photographer and also does video coverage of parties and photo editing. She has earned a lot from this business, and has been able to pay school fees for her two school-going children and buy a plot of land where she is constructing a permanent house for her family within Ibanda town. 

Christine is applying for a loan of UGX (Uganda new shillings) 2,000,000 to buy building materials for finishing up her house, mainly roofing and fixing doors and windows in her house. 

Christine’s major challenge is the high rent charged by landlords within the town which sometimes strains her earnings.

Her dream is to be a landlady in the future. Christine is honest and a hard-working woman.

loans.use: To buy roofing materials for her house.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 45 years old and has two children. Arlene is married and both of her children are in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlene has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 38 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 12 y 3 años de edad de los que únicamente el de 12 años estudia. Pedro estudio hasta sexto grado, porque no tenia las condiciones económicas para terminar sus estudios.

Pedro es agricultor desde que tenia 12 años, tiene cultivos de plátano, maíz, pipían entre otros. Su día comienza a las 4 de la mañana, ordeña 3 vacas y luego las lleva al campo, para ello camina 20 minutos hasta el lugar donde las deja, por la tarde el ganado lo recoge su hijo.

El préstamo, será utilizado en la compra de 5 terneros para repasto, para provechar  el pasto de invierno y comprara 3 sacos de fertilizante, para fertilizar la platanera. 

Su sueño es tener un establo con mucho ganado y a la vez tener un camión de 4 toneladas para vender su producto en el mercado, lugar donde le pagan a mejor precio. Con esos ingresos ayudar a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en: Pedro, 38, is married and has three children, ages 18, 12, and 3. Only the 12-year-old is in school. Pedro went to school up until the sixth grade, because he did not have the economic resources to finish his schooling. Pedro has been a farmer since he was 12. He grows bananas, corn, pipian squash, and other crops. His day starts at four in the morning. He milks three cows, then takes them to the field. To do this, he walks 20 minutes to the place where he keeps them. In the afternoons, his son collects the cattle. The loan will be used to buy five calves to graze, in order to take advantage of the winter grazing, and he will buy three sacks of fertilizer to fertilize the banana plants. His dream is to have a cowshed with lots of cattle and also to have a four-ton truck to sell his goods at the markets, a place where they pay him a better price. With this income, he will help his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy five calves for grazing and three sacks of fertilizer for his banana crop

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 54-year-old married woman who is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She requested a loan for her husband’s fruit-selling business. Her husband has owned a fruit-selling business for many years. He has grown old and is about to hand over his shop to his elder son. As per his son's requirement, he wants to renovate his shop. He wants to make a wooden frame box for the display of each fruit, paint the walls and create a better position for sitting.

His son has grown and gained a lot of experience in the fruit-selling business. Now he knows the fruit's market rates, wholesalers and how to tackle the customers. But her husband does not have sufficient funds to do the renovations. Therefore, Naseem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband can renovate his fruit shop.

Naseem hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon.

Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to renovate her husband's fruit shop

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo, tiene la edad de 63 años, está soltero y vive con una  hija actualmente. El quiere comprar semilla de frijoles y los insumos y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El cuenta con el terreno y lo que quiere es sembrar frijoles  para poder aprovechar el terreno. El pretende con esta siembra  generar una buena  producción de frijoles  y así también le genere ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar su bienestar. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 63 years old, single, and currently lives with his daughter. He wants to buy bean seeds and supplies as well as labor to help him out. He has the land and wants to plant beans to make the most of it. With this planting he hopes to generate a good crop of beans, and in turn, generate earnings to carry on with his project and improve his well-being. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other loans before in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a small-scale drinks retail vendor in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a plantation worker. 

Hannah has been preparing and selling drinks in plastics for some time now. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to prepare and sell an increased quantity of drinks, thus allowing her to meet rising customers' demands. 

She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a stand for her drinks business, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to prepare and sell an increased quantity of drinks, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Rebecca is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling coconut oil in Fretsi (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Rebecca is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Rebecca wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of coconut oil. In the long term, Rebecca plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Theresa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling soft drinks and food in Fretsi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. 

Theresa is married and has two children. Her husband is unemployed. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Theresa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Kirile

texts.en:
Kirile is a 44-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and three children in a small village of Ozurgeti district. Kirile is unemployed now, and his wife works as a housekeeper and gets 150 GEL (Georgian Lari) per month. 

Kirile is involved in agricultural activities. He has a plot of agricultural land and grows maize and nut trees. He is a very hardworking man and always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers. 

Kirile decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL to purchase a cow. After purchasing a cow, they will start producing dairy products to sell. This will increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 32 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Jinky works very hard to provide for them.

Jinky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Jinky has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, sugar, bread, rice and school supplies. 

In the future, Jinky would like to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es:
Blanca de 32 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos de 13 9 y 7 años de edad todos asisten a la escuela, debido a las dificultades económicas que pasaba su familia en aquella época solo pudo estudiar hasta segundo grado. Su esposo es agricultor y ambos trabajan la tierra.

 Tiene alrededor de 13 años de experiencia cultivando la tierra con su esposo, esta actividad la aprendió de su pareja, se vio en la necesidad de ayudarle para sacar los trabajos y así aprendió el oficio.
Su día comienza a las 4:30 am.  se levanta  para preparar el desayuno para su familia y despachar a los niños a la  escuela. Para llegar al lugar de trabajo camina cerca de 30 minutos, trabaja 6 horas y luego regresa a preparar el almuerzo; además de todo esto cuida dos vacas en la casa que le producen leche para consumo familiar.

El préstamo, será utilizado en la compra de una bolsa de semillas y 6 sacos de fertilizante, 2 galones de herbicidas y lo demás para pagar mano de obra  para la siembra . 

Su sueño para un futuro es dejar a sus hijos una vivienda no de bahareque como la que están viviendo en estos momentos, que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y también llegar a tener por lo menos 5 vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Blanca is 32 years old, married and has 3 children, 7, 9 and 13 years old. All the children go to school. Due to the economic difficulties that her family experienced at the time Blanca only studied until Grade Two. Her husband is a farmer and they both work the land.

Blanca has 13 years experience farming with her husband, an activity she learned from her parents. She had to help them carry out their work and learned by doing this. She starts her day at 4:30 am. She gets up to make breakfast for the family and get the children off to school. It is a 30 minute walk to work. She works for 6 hours and then returns home to prepare lunch. Besides this she takes care of the two cows they have that produce the milk that they consume in their household. 

Blanca will use this loan to buy a bag of seeds, six bags of fertilizer, two gallons of herbicide and pay for manpower to do the seeding. Her dream for the future is to leave her children a house, not the wattle and daub one they currently reside in. She wants her children to finish their studies and also that they end up owning at least 5 milk cows.

loans.use: to buy a bag of seeds, six bags of fertilizer, two gallons of herbicide and pay for manpower to do the seeding.

loans.name: Sivai

texts.en:
Sivai is a 43-year-old married woman with three children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro, tamu and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Sivai has requested a loan to buy chemicals, backpack sprayer, bush-knives, wheelbarrow and a rake for her plantation.
 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Sivai hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, backpack sprayer, bush-knives, wheelbarrow and a rake for her plantation.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with no children. She has received some schooling until the end of middle school. Currently, Agnes sells vegetable products in Fretsi (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about two years. 

Her husband is a minerals worker. Agnes’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Agnes will use the loan to increase her existing vegetable stock to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Agnes plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets

loans.use: to increase her existing vegetable stock to expand her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy works hard to support her family. Mercy is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Mercy requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her pigs.

Mercy has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Majeeda

texts.en:
Majeeda is a 45-year-old lady and has been stitching clothes for the past several years.
 
She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income received to support her entire family. Her sewing machine has become out of order. 
However, due to lack of savings and funds, Majeeda is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.
 
She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new sewing machine to create means of increasing revenue, so she may generate a healthier source of income.

Majeeda hopes that this loan will prove positive and beneficial for her, and will be the cause for getting more income.

She is the mother of seven children. Her husband also contribute to household expenses but his income is very poor. 
Majeeda says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Theresa did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, she sells palm oil in Fretsi (near Takoradi). She has been doing so for about a year. She is married to a farmer and together they have 5 children. She uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Theresa will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of palm oil, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of palm oil, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling coconut and palm oil in Fretsi (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Elizabeth is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

She wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of coconut and palm oil. In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of coconut and palm oil.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a small scale clothing retailer in Fretsi (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education up to middle school. She is married and has a child. Her husband is a store operator. Linda has been working as a clothing retailer for close to 2 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of clothing to sell, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a clothing stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of clothing for sale, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Amidah

texts.en: Amidah, an aged widow, sells groceries in a trading center outside Mbarara town. She has done this business for many years in order to meet the needs of her grandchildren, some of whom are orphans. She is dedicated and hardworking and this has enabled her business to keep going despite her old age. However, she needs tuition to take her grandchildren, who have been on holiday, back to school. She will use the income from her grocery to repay the loan. She thanks Kiva lenders through Ugafode for supporting even the elderly who are shunned by most banks.

loans.use: To pay tuition.

loans.name: Exequila

texts.en:
Exequila is 60 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers. Exequila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 41 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Gerlie is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gerlie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gerlie has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gerlie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 46 years old and the mother of four children, all of whom are currently studying in school.

For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling goods and services from her general store in Malindi where she earns a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. Florence is applying for her second loan of KES 60,000 to purchase additional stocks needed for her business. 

She will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees, purchase food for the family, and expand her current business. Florence hopes to own her own supermarket in future to help improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of goods for her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell recyclable materials business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more recyclable materials to sell for her buy-and-sell recyclable materials business.

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
David de 72 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 4 hijos de 34, 33, 31 y 26 años de edad todos se independizaron ya de su padre, quien una vez estuvo casado. Él se crio únicamente con su madre que al enfermar ya no lo pudo mantener en la escuela, por lo que estudio hasta octavo grado y tuvo que trabajar para ayudarla económicamente.

Tiene 55 años de ser agricultor, este oficio lo aprendió cuando dejo de estudiar para trabajar en las algodoneras. David también es voluntario en la comunidad, si necesitan mano de obra para cualquier actividad , él siempre esta dispuesto.

El préstamo ser utilizado para iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de granos básicos, comprara arroz, maíz, maicillo frijol, azúcar entre otros producto como café instantáneo

Entre los retos que tiene David, el mas grande es aprender computación, pues él dice que "nunca es tarde para aprender", también quiere terminar e bachillerato y reparar su casa.
texts.en:
Seventy-two-year-old David is single and has four children who are 34, 33, 31, and 26 and who are all independent from their father, who was once married.  He was raised by his mother alone and when she fell ill she was not able to keep him in school, which is why he only studied up until the 8th grade and he had to work to help her financially.

He has been a farmer for 55 years.  He learned this profession when he left school to work for cotton growers.  David is also a volunteer in the community; whenever a helping hand is needed he is always available.

His loan will be used to start a small business selling staple grains.  He will buy rice, corn, sorghum, beans, and sugar, among other products, such as instant coffee.

Among the challenges David faces, learning computer skills is the greatest, but he says it is never too late to learn.  He also wants to complete his high school diploma and repair his house.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, sorghum, beans, and sugar, among other products.

loans.name: Cristina Dolores

texts.es:
Cristina de 44 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 22 y 23 años de edad, dos trabajan y la menor estudia, su esposo trabaja en una cooperativa. Por la situación económica de su familia cristina solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado.

Tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de tamales, lo aprendió de su madre que también se dedicaba a lo mismo. Esta actividad la realiza todos los días, una vez terminados los tamales, sale a venderlos por toda la comunidad hasta termina r el producto.

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de utensilios de cocina que le faciliten la elaboración de tamales, comenta que los que tiene en este momento no le sirven, además quiere construir una cocina artesanal para poder cocinar los tamales más rápido y salir a venderlos más temprano.

Cristina quiere poder vender mas producto, para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, y algún día dejarles una buena herencia
texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Cristina is in a relationship and has three children who are 16, 22, and 23 years old.  Two are working and the youngest is in school.  Her partner works at a cooperative.  Due to her family's financial circumstances, she was only able to study up until the sixth grade.

She has been making tamales for 20 years.  She learned to do it from her mother, who does the same work.  She makes them every day and once the tamales are done, she goes out into the community to sell them until she runs out. 

She will use her loan to buy kitchen utensils so making tamales will be easier.  She tells us that the ones she currently has do not work.  She also wants to build an artisanal stove so she can cook her tamales faster and get out to sell them earlier. 

Cristina wants to be able to sell more of her product so she can improve her family's living conditions and one day leave them a good inheritance.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and to build and artisanal stove

loans.name: Magsarjav

texts.en: Mr. Magsarjav, 22 years old, lives with his parents and sister in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been selling spare parts of trucks to local people since 2009. He is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 tugriks to buy insulation materials, such as fiberglass, foam and felts, in order to insulate his home. As a result, his family will be able to live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the oncoming winter. Also, they will begin to burn less coal for heating due to the insulation and so release less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to buy insulation materials

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 45 years old and married.  She has 4 children who are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luis Orlando

texts.es: Luis con 36 años de edad es padre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental. Durante su vida productiva siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente. Hace 9 años montó un negocio de video juegos y venta de mercancía, obteniendo muy buenos resultados y logrando ser reconocido en el sector; esto le permitió abrir un segundo negocio hace 2 años, donde ofrece el servicio de internet, venta de minutos y recargas a celular, venta de accesorios y servicio de mantenimiento de equipos móviles; trabaja todos los días de 10:00 am  hasta las 10:00 pm y, cuando tiene mucho trabajo pendiente contrata a una persona que le colabora; él aprovecha la ventaja de estar ubicado en una zona muy comercial y por esto ha tenido excelentes resultados, generando muy buenos ingresos para su familia. El cliente se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, organizado, pujante y disciplinado, lucha con esmero para que sus negocios sigan creciendo. Solicita el crédito como apoyo para invertirlo en la compra de surtido (equipos celulares, tarjetas de recarga, sim card, accesorios para celular), con esto podrá aumentar sus ventas, pues tendrá más variedad de productos disponible y equipos celulares con tecnología moderna y así podrá satisfacer las necesidades y requerimientos de sus clientes, dando como resultados un incremento en el margen de ganancia y mejor rentabilidad. Luis desea continuar trabajando arduamente para que su familia no pase por ningún tipo de dificultad económica y sus hijos puedan tener una excelente educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Thirty-six-year-old Luis is the father of two children and lives in a common-law marriage with his partner.  During his working life he has always been an independent shopkeeper.  Nine years ago he started a video game business that also sold merchandise, which produced very good results and led to him being recognized in the community.  This allowed him to open a second business two years ago that offers internet service, sells minutes and recharges cell phones, sells cell phone accessories, and provides repair services for cell phones.  He works every day from 10:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and when he has a lot of work to do he hires someone to work with him.  He takes advantage of being located in a very commercial neighborhood, which is why he has gotten excellent results that have generated a lot of income for his family.  He is known for being a hardworking, organized, strong, and disciplined man who works painstakingly so his businesses will grow.  He is asking for this loan to help him invest in stock (cell phones, recharge cards, SIM cards, cell phone accessories).  This will allow him to increase his sales, as he will have a wider variety of products available and cell phones with modern technology, which will satisfy the needs and demands of his customers.  The result of this will be an increase in his profit margins and better viability.  Luis wants to keep working hard so his family will not face any financial hardships and so his children can get and excellent education and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock (cell phones, recharge cards, SIM cards, cell phone accessories)

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and single with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, such as bread, fabric conditioners, laundry soap, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries, in her general store.

Maricel has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from retailing electronic mobile load. Maricel hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, such as bread, fabric conditioners, laundry soap, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries, in her general store

loans.name: Esmeralda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esmeralda de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 13 y 17 años de edad, ambos estudian. Por su parte ella solo pudo terminar sus estudios hasta noveno grado.

tiene 11 años dedicandose al comercio, aprendio por iniciativa propia, realiza su venta de ropa y utencilios de plastico todos los dias de manera ambulante a grandes distancias en la comunidad con la ayuda de su tio, de 8 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde.

El prestamo sera utilizado en la compra de materiales de contruccion: Madera, Clavos, laminas y demas pra construir un cafetín a la orilla de la carretera y vender panes.

Con el cafetín construido espera convertirlo en una tienda y tener mejores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 30 years old, the single mother of two children aged 13 and 17 years old. Both of them study. Esmeralda for her part only continued her studies up to Grade 9. She has been in business 11 years, selling clothing and plastic goods from door to door. She covers a lot of distance. She labors from 8 am until 4 pm. Her uncle helps her. 

Esmeralda will use the loan to buy construction materials like wood, nails etc.to build a small cafe at the side of the road.and sell bread. After the cafe is built she hopes to convert it into a store and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like wood, nails etc.to build a small cafe.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a young woman, aged 27 years old, from a local cell in Kakoba Division - Mbarara district. She grew up in a very poor neighborhood. This forced her to study nursing so that she could come back and help her community. She succeeded in pursuing her career, and now she is working in the community health center. Through a little facilitation from the health center, she has managed to construct a house and now she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to complete her house. She is happy that soon she will be leaving the class of tenants to that of house owners - courtesy of the Kiva lenders. She is determined and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida, age 53, is a married woman and mother of four children. 
She has been successfully running a small general store in her community with the support of her husband; both are old but making efforts to earn income. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 
She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.
She wants to thank Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy general store items to sell.

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José de 67 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, todos ellos independizados. Su esposa es ama de casa.

José tiene 50 años de experiencia trabajando en agricultura, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió de su padre, todos los días se levanta a las 5 de la mañana, para ir a trabajar donde tiene sembrado y regresa cerca de la 1 de la tarde. Además cría y vende ganado.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos terneras, que serán engordadas con los residuos de la cosecha de maíz y venderlos 4 meses después.

Quiere seguir repitiendo la rutina, tiene ya varios años que compra ganado para engordar y vender y le han quedado 4 vacas lecheras, piensa seguir trabajando así para heredar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose, 67, attended school through the first year of high school.  He is married, and has 3 children who are all now independent.  His wife is a homemaker.  

Jose has 50 years of experience working in agriculture.  He learned everything he knows from his father.  Every day, he gets up at 5am to go to work on his farm, and he returns around 1pm.  He also raises and sells livestock. 

He will use this loan to buy 2 calves that he will fatten with the by-products of his corn harvest and sell in 4 months.

He wants to continue to repeat this routine, as he has already bought cattle to fatten and sell for a number of years, and this has provided him with 4 dairy cows.  He plans to continue to work so that he can leave his farm to his children.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives in the Kisii area of Kenya. He has 3 children. His primary income sources are eggs, tea, crops, and transportation services. He has been doing this work for 10 years. His highest monthly expense is school fees. 

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Source  of income!" His biggest challenge is "Lack of market." The animals on his farm have not been given names.

Richard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Because it helps small holder farmers like me improve their life." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required micro-finance training session: "If used wisely the loan will improve the lives of small holder farmers like me." When asked "How will this loan benefit his family," Richard replied "Improve living standard."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Richard owns the following: "poultry, and an automobile" but does not own a "cow, pig, pump, bicycle, or motorcycle." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, solar power, TV, and DVD" but does not have "electricity, running water, or a sewing machine."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 78 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado debido a las dificultades económicas de su tiempo, está casado y tiene dos hijos, ambos independizados. Su esposa es ama de casa y es la única que vive con él.

Desde pequeño le gusto la agricultura, iba con su padre donde tenían la parcela de maíz y así fue aprendiendo el oficio, hoy en día es agricultor y negociante de ganado bovino, compra y revende y no deja una oportunidad en la que pueda ganar unos centavos de más. Todos los días se levanta a las 3:30 am para darle de comer a sus vacas, irse a trabajar y regresar a las 2 de la tarde.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar un par de bueyes, engordarlos y utilizando la carreta trasladar la cosecha desde la montaña al lugar de donde permanecerá guardada.
Para un futuro seguirá trabajando con ganado, porque le genera mejores ingresos que los cultivos.
texts.en:
Jose, 78, has only a 6th grade education because of the difficult economic times of his youth.  He is married and has 2 children who are both now independent.  His wife is a homemaker, and she is the only one who now lives with him.

Ever since he was very young, Jose has liked farming.  He used to go with his father where he had a plot where he cultivated corn, and this is where he learned how to farm.  Today, he is a farmer and cattle trader.  He buys and sells, never overlooking an opportunity to earn a few cents more.  He gets up every day at 3:30am to feed his cows and go to work; he returns at about 2pm.
