Jose will use this loan to buy a pair of oxen to fatten and use to transport his harvest from the mountain to the place where he stores it.  In the future, he will continue to work with livestock, because this generates more income than his farming activities.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen

loans.name: Symon

texts.en: Symon is 68 years old and married. His children are all grown ups. He is a dairy farmer in Kapchepkor who supplies milk to the nearby dairies and has been in operation for over a period of 30 years, earning an income of KES 12,000. He has asked for a loan of KES 50,000. This is his 4th term loan from KADET LTD and he wishes to use this money to add more livestock to his business for milk purposes.  The profits he gets will be used as savings and to build a permanent house for his family. His dream is to expand his dairy farm.

loans.use: To add livestock

loans.name: Irvin Sadrac

texts.es:
Irvin de 23 años de edad, lastimosamente no pudo estudiar debido a las condiciones económicas de su familia, está acompañado, no tiene hijos y su pareja se dedica a ser ama de casa y solo ellos dos viven en casa.

Tiene 10 años trabajando como jornalero en el campo de agricultura y ganadería, compra y vende ganado, todo lo aprendió por iniciativa propia. Se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para ir donde su patrón, camina 5 kilómetros y su jornada de trabajo termina a la 1 de la tarde.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos terneritas para engordarlas, luego venderlas un par de meses después esperando tener una buena ganancia para repetir la rutina.

Quiere darse a conocer como comerciante de ganado, independizarse, hacer sus propios negocios, tener hijos y darles el estudio que él no pudo tener.
texts.en:
Irvin is 23 years old. Unfortunately, he was not able to attend university due to his family's economic situation. He has a live-in partner. He has no children, and his partner dedicates herself to being a homemaker. Only the two of them live in their house. 

For 10 years, he has worked as a day laborer in agriculture and ranching. He buys and sells livestock. He learned all of this on his own initiative. He gets up at 4 in the morning to go to his employer's property. He walks 5 kilometers, and his work day ends at 1 in the afternoon. 

The loan will be used to buy two calves to fatten up. He will sell them a few months later, hoping to make a good profit and to repeat the process. 

He wants to become known as a livestock merchant, become independent, have his own businesses, have children, and give them the opportunity to study that he did not have.

loans.use: to buy two calves to fatten up.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 56 years old and has a boutique business which she has been running for 6 years. She gets a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She is married and has 5 children. She will use this loan to purchase more bags, clothes and shawls to sell. This is her 1st loan term and she plans to use her anticipated profits to open up another boutique business. In the future, Cecilia hopes to have a stable business and gain more income so as to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rene Alonso

texts.es:
Rene de 21 años de edad,  termino sus estudios de educación media, esta acompañado y tiene una niña de tres meses que la cuida su pareja.

Rene es agricultor, oficio que aprendió desde pequeño con su padre, cuando dejo de de estudiar, se dedico completamente a trabajos agrícolas. Rene también trabaja ocasionalmente con la alcaldía de su comunidad 

El préstamo sera utilizado en la compra de un par de novillos, para trabajarlos como bueyes el siguiente año así no tendrá que pagarle a alguien para que le prepare la tierra.

Rene tiene planeado tener todo lo que necesita para trabajar la tierra, comenta que le hace falta una carreta y un par de cosas mas, ademas quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rene is 21 years old. He finished secondary school. He has a live-in partner, and he has a 3-month-old daughter whom his partner takes care of. 

Rene is a farmer, a profession he learned from his father when he was a child. When he left school, he dedicated himself full-time to agricultural work. Rene also occasionally works for the local government in his community. 

The loan will be used to buy a pair of young bulls, in order to work with them as oxen next year. In this way, he will not have to pay someone to plow the fields for him. 

Rene plans to have everything he needs to work the soil. He comments that he still needs a wagon and a few other things. He also wants his children to finish their education.

loans.use: to buy a pair of young bulls.

loans.name: Kotiya

texts.en: Kotiya is 45 years old and married with 7 children. She is a charcoal seller in Nairobi town and has been in this business for 10 years. She gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES and will use this loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. This is her 2nd loan and she will use her profits to open up a grocery shop. Kotiya's hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and raise a happy family.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for selling

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 70 years old and is a farmer. She grows cash crops and keeps cattle. She has been in the farming business for 28 years. This will be her third loan term and she plans to use the money to buy cattle feed and fertilizer. She will use the income generated to buy more cows. In the future, Jane hopes to become a large scale farmer and also hopes to install electricity in her house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cattle feed.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is 52 years old and married with twelve children.
She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elpedia is borrowing 12,000 Phillipine pesos through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Elpedia has been in pig fattening for two years and earns additional income from general store.
She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en: Alphonce is 41 years old and married with 4 children. He sells cereals in Kangundo town; he has been in this business for 19 years now and it has been profitable. This is his sixth loan term and he paid his previous loans successfully. He will use this loan to buy more cereals to sell. These include maize and beans. This will enable him have more stock and thereby meet his clients' demands as well as make more income. He will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children. In the future, Alphonce hopes to expand his cereals shop by stocking more maize, beans, green grams and rice. He also plans to educate his children to tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Ninfa

texts.en:
Ma. Ninfa is 63 years old, married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Ninfa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Ninfa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ma. Ninfa has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Ma. Ninfa would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been a poultry farmer in the town of Kangundo for the last year. She is 46 years old and married with four children. Her husband also provides additional income for the family's needs.

This will be her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of poultry for rearing. She will later supply the poultry to the market. She will use the generated income to add more poultry.

Josephine hopes to become a large scale poultry farmer.

loans.use: To buy more poultry for rearing and resale.

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru: Бурмакан 63 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Бурмакан  -среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бурмакан занимается животноводством, стартовав 27 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бурмакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 4 нетели, 1 лошадь, 1 коза. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурмакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бурмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Burmakan is 63 years old. She is a widow. After her husband’s death, she raised her children alone. She also has been running a farm on her own. Burmakan has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Burmakan raises livestock, having launched this business 27 years ago by buying livestock for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Burmakan’s hard work, her farm now includes three dairy cows, four heifers, one horse and one goat. Her monthly income is 16,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Burmakan has turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance bank for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to increase her headcount by buying cattle. Burmakan plans to use the revenue from her loan for an additional increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose tiene 30 años y vive en al ciudad de Pisco. Jose es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo y luego de mucho ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de decoraciones para cualquier clase de evento como cumpleaños, bautizos, matrimonios, entre otros, con lo cual puede solventar sus gastos de manutención, jose trabaja alrededor de 10 horas, en especial los fines de semana que son los días en los cuales hay mas eventos; Jose cree que le esta yendo bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo realizar buenas decoraciones.

Jose agradece el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar materiales para su negocio como gasa, telas, entre otros, con lo cual podrá realizar sus decoraciones con mas estética y mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Ser el mejor decorador de su ciudad”.
texts.en:
Jose, 30, lives in the city of Pisco. He is a man with a desire to move forward. This is why he worked and saved to start his design business, serving all kinds of events including birthdays, baptisms, weddings, and other events. This helps him make the payments to support himself. Jose works about 10 hours a day, especially on the weekends because there are more events those days. Jose thinks his business is going well because he is very kind and, above all, he has creates good designs.

Jose is grateful for the help from the Kiva loans because they will allow him to buy supplies such as muslin, fabric, and other items. He will use these to create designs with more aesthetic and improve his income. This will help him keep keep working toward his biggest dream: to be the best designer in his city.

loans.use: to buy muslin and fabric.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en: Otar is a 55-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two sons in the Batumi district of  western Georgia. His wife teaches geography at a local public school and earns 360 GEL per month. Their sons go to school. Otar gets orders to paint houses and receives some income. As he does not have a stable income, Otar decided to request a loan and open a clothing shop. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $ 3000 and purchase a stock of clothing. He will also rent a commercial space for the shop. Otar will go to Turkey and purchase clothing at wholesale prices. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family, providing them with additional income.

loans.use: to open a clothing shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Likoni near Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and blessed with five children, all of whom attend school.

For the past ten years Mary has been a farmer (she also owns some rental houses which provide extra income for the family). A lack of money is her biggest farming challenge.

She learned of Milango through friends and now seeks a 39,770 KES loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals and seed. She hopes that she will fully commercialize her activities on the farm. The extra income will improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals and seed.

loans.name: 3.18.345.2.yên Thọ Group

texts.en:
Phương is 47 years old, married and has one grown child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

For more than ten years Phương has raised poultry and cattle to sell. A lack of capital is a great obstacle to her improving her business.

Phương is the leader of the 3.18.345.2.Yên Thọ solidarity group, which consists of three members. This will be her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is applying for a 16,500,000 VND for her group. With her portion she will buy chicks to raise and sell in the future.

With her profits Phương hopes to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for it.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.18.346.3.yên Thọ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chính works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Chính is 50 years old and she is married with two children.
Chính is the group leader of the 3.18.346.3.Yên Thọ solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Chính first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW).
Chính has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Chính faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chính hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Enkhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbat, 28 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an inspector at the state inspection authority since 2008. 

His wife is unemployed and stays at home looking after their children. This year their elder son is beginning his study at high school. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to pay for his son's high school tuition fees. 

He thinks investing in education is the best thing he can do for his children. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for his son's high school tuition fees.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has a retail shop in Tala town and has been in the business for the past three years. She is 30 years old and married with two children. Her husband also provides income for the support of the family.

This is her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more stocks of goods for sell. These include sugar, flour, rice and packed milk, among other items. She anticipates to make more profits with which she will use to provide for the needs of her family.

Grace hopes to grow her business and be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, such as sugar, flour, rice and packed milk, among other items.

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma, who is in her early thirties, is married with a child who is in school. For a year now she has helped support her family with her beverage shop where she sells beer, water, soda, juices, wine and whiskey. She works from 4:00 p.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

This will be Mwajuma’s first loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. She is applying for 8,000,000 TZS to be apportioned among Love, her six-member group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Mwajuma will use her portion of this loan to buy more beverages for her shop. Her ambition is to greatly improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Kalyani Group

texts.en:
Mamana, age about 47 years, resides with her husband and two sons, ages about 22 and 20 years, in Muniguda of Rayagada District in Odisha, India. The lady standing at the extreme right with a raised hand in the photograph is Mamana. In the year 2009, she formed a group with other members of her village to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

For the last five years, Mamana is making mixture (snacks) and selling it. Her husband is supporting the business. Mamana’s household income per month is about 8,000 Indian rupees. According to Mamana, this amount is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenditures. So she wants to expand her business to earn some extra income.

She has already availed three loans from Mahashakti with 100% on time repayment. It is her fourth cycle loan. With the present loan, she wants to purchase gram flour [made from ground chickpeas], oil, dry chilly, puffed rice and spices, etc., for the preparation of mixture. Some part of the loan will be invested to purchase utensils for making mixture. She has a dream to establish a big mixture factory in Muniguda.

Out of the other five members of the group, Tuku and Pratima need a loan for their betel shop and saloon respectively. The rest of the three members, Manju, Lalita and Jhara, want a loan for a leaf plate business.

loans.use: to purchase gram flour, oil, dry chilly, puffed rice and spices, etc.

loans.name: 3.18.347.3.yên Thọ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle to resell.

Hương is 22 years old and she is married with two children..
Hương is the group leader of the 3.18.347.3.Yên Thọ solidarity group, which consists of five members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Hương's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW).
Hương has been involved in this business for two years.
The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 32 years old and lives in the village of Vzashen which is in the Tavush region of Armenia. He is married and has two children, a daughter and a son. Arman lives with his wife, two children and parents. His father works as a welder.  His mother and wife do not work but they take care of the children and their house. Arman has a car with which he provides taxi services to nearby villages. Arman and his family are also engaged in farming and agriculture. On their farm, they breed two cows, two heifers, two piglets, five beehives and twenty chickens. In addition, Arman and his father cultivate wheat and fruit trees on their plot of land.  During the year, they sell milk, meat, eggs, honey, fig, persimmon and wheat. They also cultivate some vegetables for family use.
Arman asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy animal fodder and organize autumn sowing activities.  Arman has successfully paid back three loans from Kiva's partner Nor Horizon in the past.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder and organize autumn sowing activities.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is 33 years old and lives in the village of Zovaber in Gegharkunik region. He is married and has two children. Arsen lives with his wife, children, and parents. His father works as a locksmith. Arsen’s mother and wife do not work since they take care of the children and their house. 

Arsen has no higher education, but he is a skilled welder and he is very often hired for welding work. But Arsen’s main occupation is farming and agriculture. He has in his farm a cow, six sheep, four lambs, two goats, and thirty chickens. He also has a plot of land on which he cultivates vegetables for his family's use. 

Arsen is a very laborious person since, together with his welding, farming, and agriculture, he also works as a driver.
He asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams since he wants to buy a passenger minibus as he plans to start transferring students from regions into Yerevan city.

loans.use: to buy a passenger minibus as he plans to start transferring students from regions into Yerevan city.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary bananas and sugar cane growing region. She has five children and has been doing this work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Source of income.' Her biggest challenge is 'Lack of market, poor roads.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Mary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Meets clients financial needs.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Low interest rate, client friendly.'

Her highest monthly expenses are school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Mary replied: 'Improve living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mary owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: to put up a dairy unit.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married with 5 grown children. She is 56 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Wilma is planting coconut trees and banana trees to grow fruit to sell. She has been selling crops for over 21 years and has made favorable returns. Her spouse works as a carpenter but his work is impermanent in nature. Each month, Wilma earns an approximate total of 5,680 PHP from all sources. 

Wilma joined GDMPC in 2011 and her previous loan that she used to purchase fertilizer was successfully repaid.

She requests a new loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and to cover the costs of plowing the farm to enhance the growth of crops and for a high potential of return on investment.

In the future, Wilma hopes to expand the cultivated area and raise more of these plants to gain more profit. She also plans to repair some parts of her house to live comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to cover the costs of plowing the farm

loans.name: Mirzaim

texts.ru: Мирзаим 62 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 6 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Мирзаим- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мирзаим занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мирзаим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бык, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мирзаим обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мирзаим планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Mirzaim is a 62-year-old widow.  Following the death of her husband, she alone raises her 6 children and tends to her farm.  She has a high school education, and the brunt of her income comes from raising livestock, having started 10 years ago with 12,000 somoni worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, her farm currently has 1 dairy cow, 1 bull, and 1 calf.  Her monthly income is 8,000 somoni.  To further develop her farm, Mirzaim is seeking a loan in the amount of 120,000 somoni from Bai Tushum & Partners to buy more cows for her farm.  She plans to reinvest the additional income that the loan will allow her to buy even more livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 66 years old and does livestock farming in Kangundo town. She has been in the farming business for the last 13 years. She is married and has six children who are all over 18 years old.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy feed for her cattle.

In addition to livestock farming, Monicah also has a retail shop. She plans to buy goods to sell, including salt, rice and flour.  She hopes that this loan will allow her to make more profits in her business which she will use to pay school fees for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle and goods to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa works hard to support five children. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Adelfa requested a 1,800 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Adelfa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is an experienced farmer from the village Aygeshat of Armavir region. She lives with her three sons; two of them are unemployed, and one of them is a serviceman in the army. Karine is engaged in the cultivation of tomatoes, onions, apricots, cherries and pears. Her sons are helping her a lot in selling the agricultural products in the local market. To be able to run the agribusiness in a sustainable way, Karine needs a loan of USD 1500 to purchase fertilizers, to pay for the harvesting services and to buy two calves. It will help Karine and her family to meet their daily living costs more effectively. The family will be very grateful to all the lenders for helping them to collect the needed amount of the loan and sustaining their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, to pay for the harvesting services and to buy two calves

loans.name: Mirjete

texts.en:
Mirjete lives in the southwest part of Kosovo. She is married and has one child who is 2 years old. Mirjete is a housewife, cooking and taking care of her child and her husband. The family's main source of income comes from her husband, who works as a construction worker. Although he works hard, he doesn't earn enough to support the needs of his family. 

Currently, the family has managed to build a new house, but they could not finish the roof. For this reason, Mirjete is requesting a loan to finish the home's roof. Mirjete and her family are very happy for this support and thankful to Kiva lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To finish the home's roof.

loans.name: Tatul

texts.en: Tatul is a private entrepreneur from the village of Dalarik in the Armavir region of Armenia. He lives with his wife and son, and he is the only breadwinner of the family. He runs a small local store where he sells grocery products and construction materials. This is the only source of family’s income. As the family’s daily needs grow day by day, Tatul needs to enlarge the assortment of goods he sells in the store so it will function more sustainably.  A loan of 3,000 USD will be a huge support to this hard-working man and his family and will enable him to purchase more grocery products and construction materials to resell in his store. As this is Tatul’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products previously because they had no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for the good will and support.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products and construction materials to resell in his store.

loans.name: Katenga Turibanwe Group

texts.en:
Justine, a widow with four children, is a member of a Katenga Turibamwe Group subgroup. She is businesswoman who cultivates, buys and sells agricultural produce, which she has done since 2000. In addition to the produce business, she also does subsistence farming, which is her other source of income.

The business is located in rural Kakyera-Katenga-Mitooma, and she started the business to be able to develop her family and meet their basic needs. Her clients are mainly people from the neighboring district, and she hopes to buy more produce using the loan money (400,000 shillings). 

Justine describes herself as an honest business partner and says this has greatly helped her in her business. She says competition is her main challenge, but she hopes to overcome it with time. Her hope is to get more loans, which will eventually help her to break through financially and enable her to meet her children's educational needs adequately. She thanks the group members for standing by each other and Kiva lenders for the great support.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce to sell.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Juvy requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Juvy is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Purevsuren, 40 years old, live with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. She has been working as a conductor of a bus at a transportation company since 2010. Her husband is a welder and works at a building company. 

Their elder son recently enrolled in university and their elder daughter studies at college. The younger two children both go to high school. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to pay for her eldest son's tuition fee. She believes that investing in education is the best she can do for her children.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Hisen

texts.en:
Hisen is a taxi driver, 60 years old and married. Due to a lack of family income, he chose to work as a taxi driver because it is the only source of work which allows him to earn enough income to meet the family’s expenses. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns enough from this employment to support the needs of his family. 
He likes his job and he has very good relationships with his customers because he is a very responsible and skilled driver. Being the only financial provider for his family, he has not been able to save money for the days when business is slow or he has problems with his vehicle. This is why Hisen, for the first time, is requesting a loan in order to repair his taxi, as he has been unable to repair it in recent times. His goal is to have a safer vehicle for transporting his customers. He is confident that this will allow him to increase his income and thereby improve his family's standard of living. He wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary banana and sugar cane growing region. She has three children and has been doing farming for four years. Her primary income sources are from selling milk, eggs, tea and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Profitable.' Her biggest challenge is 'Needs experience.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kadogo.'

Florence was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Low interest.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to farm well.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Florence replied 'Stabilize her family.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Florence owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Prosperidad

texts.en:
Prosperidad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a purified drinking water station business in the Philippines.

Prosperidad requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like containers for her business.

Prosperidad has been in this business for 10 years now.

Prosperidad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like containers for her business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Regina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transport and a general store businesses. Regina is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 37-year-old married woman. She is mother of six children and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. She has spent all of her money on household expenses and does not have any money left to buy stocks of clothing. 

She requested a loan from BRAC to buy stocks of different clothes for the winter season because the winter season is going to be starting soon, by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. 

Rehana is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. Rehana says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 40 years old and married with one child. Rosalie works very hard to provide for her family.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Rosalie has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, fabric conditioner, bath soap and coffee. 

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Mrs. Oyungerel, 45 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger on a plot of land. She has been working as a bookkeeper at the hospital since 2010. Her husband is unemployed and currently stays at home. Their older two children both go to high school while the youngest one is in kindergarten. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase felts, fiberglass and foam to insulate her Mongolian traditional ger. As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the incoming winter. Also the family will begin to burn less coal for heating due to the insulation and so will release less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase felts, fiberglass and foam

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is 26 years old. She lives with her nice family in the city of Sevan, which is in Gegharkunik region. Ani is married and she has a small, very pretty and cheerful daughter. Ani lives with her husband, father and mother-in-law. Ani’s husband works as an electrician and her father-in-law also is employed. After graduating State College in the faculty of Philology, Ani received a teacher qualification and now she is studying at a branch of Yerevan State University at the same faculty and she is already  a third year student in Ijevan city. She is in the distance learning section. Simultaneously Ani works at the boarding school which is in Dilijan city. Despite her young age, Ani is a very practical and resourceful woman.

Ani is asking for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams since she has decided to buy a car for her husband, who needs one very much in his everyday work.

loans.use: To buy a car for her husband, who needs one very much in his everyday work

loans.name: Javahir

texts.en: Javahir is from Dalarik village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, son and daughter. Javahir works in the local kindergarten as an educator. Her husband and son are labor migrants; they have migrated from another area in Armenia to be able to earn a living for the family. Javahir, with the help of her daughter, is breeding livestock including cows and hens. They are also cultivating alfalfa, tomato and watermelon. Livestock breeding and plant cultivation are very important sources of income for the family. To be able to continue it, Javahir needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase fertilizers and feed for the livestock. Javahir has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Javahir was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Javahir and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, and feed for the livestock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary banana and sugar cane growing region. She has five children and has been doing farming for 20 years. Her primary income sources are from selling milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming:'Source of income.' Her biggest challenge is 'Lack of market.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Rose was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'It helps small holder farmers to improve their life.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'We should not divert funds.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Rose replied 'Improve living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rose owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, sewing machine' but does not have 'electricity, running water, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marizza

texts.en:
Marizza is 47 years old, married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marizza has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Marizza requested a loan of PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Marizza has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Marizza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aron

texts.en:
Aron does poultry farming in Tala town. He is 53 years old and married with three children. He has been in this business for two years and it has been profitable. 

This being his second loan term, he plans to use the amount to buy more poultry for rearing as well as poultry feeds. He plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

Aron's future hopes and dreams are to supply poultry to hotels and also to educate his children to tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy poultry and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is 55 years old and he lives in Stepanavan city which is in Lori region. Gagik is married and he has two children. His daughter is already married and she lives separately with her family. His son works as a Food Service Manager. Gagik has a higher education; he graduated from Yerevan State Agricultural Institute and he has received a veterinary qualification. Gagik for many years has worked at the Stepanavan city veterinary pharmacy as the head of pharmacy. So using all his skills of past years and all his knowledge he has become engaged in swine breeding. He has a pig and seven piglets which he keeps in a cute barn he built himself.  
Gagik asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for the coming winter months. He is seriously determined to enlarge his farm and in future to start the sale of pork.

loans.use: To buy a lot of animal fodder for the coming winter months

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has a welding business in Kangundo town where he makes metal furniture. He has been in this business for six years and currently makes a monthly income of 6,000 KES. He is 26 years old and married with one child. 

He plans to use this loan to buy more welding materials such as metal for use in making the furniture. He will use the anticipated income to buy more welding machines and thereby expand his business.

This will be his fourth loan and he repaid the previous loans successfully. In future, Daniel hopes to grow his business and also open a business for his wife.

loans.use: To buy welding materials.

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru: Ахмаджону 40 лет. Он отец четырех детей. У него два сына и две дочки. Ахмаджон несколько лет работает директором в бохтарской школе города Курган-Тюбе. Пусть и работа директора школы очень ответственная, Ахмаджон справляется с ним на ура. Он хочет заниматься дополнительной работой. Ахмаджон решил у себя дома заняться животноводством. У Ахмаджона и у его жены имеется небольшой земельный участок, который в ближайшем времени превратится в скотный двор когда они на деньги от кредита и на свои сбережения купят коров и бычков. Ахмаджон долго мечтал о своем стаде коров. Теперь у него есть шанс осуществить свою мечту. Он надеется, что у него получится ухаживать за скотами. Он не боится брать на себя дополнительную работу, зная, что справится со всеми обязательствами. Несмотря на то, что Ахмаджон никогда не занимался такой деятельностью, он уверенно идет вперед зная что ему всегда придут на помощь соседи и земляки.
texts.en: Ahmadjon is 40 years old. He is a father of four children. He has two sons and two daughters. Ahmadjon has been working as a director in a school in Bohtar region of the town of Qurgan-Tube. Even though the job of a school principle is very responsible Ahmadjon has been doing his job excellently. He wants to take on additional work. Ahmadjon has decided to start animal husbandry at home. They have a small plot of land with his wife which will be remodeled into a cattle yard in the near future when they purchase cows and calves using the money from the loan. Ahmadjon has been dreaming for his own herd of cows for a long time. Right now he has a chance to make it a reality. He hopes that he will succeed at taking care of cattle. He is not afraid to take on additional work because he knows he can manage all of the responsibilities. Even though Ahmadjon has never been in this business he is moving forward with confidence because he knows that his neighbors will always be there to help him.

loans.use: to purchase large horned cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 56 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Amelita has a general store business in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks and juice in her general store.

Amelita has been in this business for 12 years. Amelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks and juice in her general store

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 57-year-old woman. She is living in Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her financial condition is not good; her husband is an old person and mostly stays at home. 
She is the mother of two daughters and six sons, all of her children are unqualified. Her sons are doing jobs but earning very low income. 
One of her daughters sews clothes at home; she sews ladies dresses. She has been using a local sewing machine which is very slow and not clean. Due to its low quality, the sewing machine has become out of order. She wants to enhance the beauty of her stitching, so she wants to buy a juki (sewing) machine instead of a local machine. 
Therefore, Rehana requested a loan for her daughter so that she could buy a new machine to enhance her tailoring work.
Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a juki (sewing) machine for her daughter's tailoring work.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29 years old and married with two children. She has been running a boutique business for three years now and currently makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. This is her first loan and she plans to use it to purchase more clothes and shawls to sell. 

She will use her anticipated profits to open up another boutique shop. 

Rose hopes to be successful and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 49-year-old single mother of four children who are in school.

She has a business selling potatoes, peas, carrots and other vegetables which she has operated for three years. She also practices farming in Ndunyu Njeru and has applied for her second loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy cabbages, carrots and potatoes to sell.  With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy a plot.

She hopes to apply for bigger loans from Kadet Ltd to enable her to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, carrots and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is a young farmer, 30 years old, who lives in the village of Pabmak in the Lori region. He lives with his parents, wife and two small daughters. Sargis is unemployed and he is fully engaged in farming and agriculture. Together with his father Sargis takes care of his large and rich farm; they breed eight cows, ten heifers and twelve piglets. Sargis has a contract with a local big dairy products factory to which he sells most of the milk from his cows. Sargis is very worried about his farm cattle for the coming winter cold months, since cold and long winters are very typical to his region. 
He asks for a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams since he needs a lot of hay to feed his farm animals during winter. He needs this loan to mow some parts of the hay and also to buy some from other villagers.

loans.use: to mow some of the hay and also to buy some from other villagers

loans.name: Sthephanny Dhainna

texts.es: Sthephanny es una joven de 24 años de edad que se dedica a comercializar mercancía como ropa y productos por catálogo; esta actividad la inició hace 2 años, gracias a que su anterior pareja le enseñó algunos conceptos básicos sobre el manejo de esta labor. Ella trabaja todos los días de la semana y ve en su labor la ventaja de que las personas de la ciudad están a la vanguardia de la moda y se preocupan por su apariencia física, lo que le da la oportunidad de vender sus productos con gran facilidad, logrando generar buenos ingresos. La cliente es pujante, activa y emprendedora, se proyecta siempre hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas, con el ánimo de seguir progresando. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido de mercancía al por mayor (cremas corporales, cosméticos, cremas faciales, ropa, entre otros), de esta forma tendrá más variedad de productos disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer las diversas necesidades y gustos. Sthephanny manifiesta que esto le ayudará a mejorar la entrada de recursos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, adicionalmente le dará la oportunidad de seguir luchando para convertirse en una empresaria exitosa.
texts.en:
Sthephanny, 24, earns a living selling merchandise such as clothing and products by catalogue.  She started her business two years ago thanks to her former partner who taught her the basic concepts of managing this type of work.  She works every day of the week and believes her work is advantageous because the people in the city are at the forefront of fashion and concerned about their physical appearance.  This allows her to sell her products more easily which generates a good income.

The borrower is an emerging, active entrepreneur who is constantly striving to reach her goals in an effort to continue progressing.  She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of wholesale merchandise (body lotion, cosmetics, face creams, clothing, etc.).  This way, she will have more product variety to offer her customers so she can cater to different needs and preferences.

Sthephanny says this will improve her income which means her family will have a better quality of life.  It will also give her the opportunity to continue struggling to become a successful business owner.

loans.use: To buy a variety of wholesale merchandise (body lotion, cosmetics, face creams, clothing, etc.)

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es: Don Ramón  vive  en casa propia  junto  a su esposa y sus dos  hijos uno de ellos trabaja y ayuda en el hogar,  él se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol  desde hace 2 años,   es una persona con buenos principios y valores  por tal motivo es muy conocido en la zona donde reside,  es responsable y muy trabajador, don Ramón está solicitando  un crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plaga, etc. y poder aumentar sus productos y sus ingresos así poder  alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ramón lives in his own home with his wife and two children, one of whom works and helps with household expenses.  Ramón is a farmer and has been growing corn and beans for two years.  He is a person with good morals and values and therefore very well-known in the area where he lives.  He is responsible and very hard-working.  

Ramón is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, plague controls, etc. to increase production and income so he can lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, plague controls, etc.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Don Elías de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia  con su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura  siembra arroz, frijoles y maíz, es una persona muy aplicada en sus labores, muy trabajador y responsable, don Elías esta solicitando un crédito para capital de trabajo necesita comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. con esto espera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elías, 59, lives in his own home with his partner and their four children.  He is a hard-working, responsible farmer who grows rice, beans and corn.  

Elías is requesting a loan to use as work capital to buy seeds, fertilizers, plague controls, etc. in an aim to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, plague controls, etc.

loans.name: Araceliz Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Araceliz habita en una comarca ubicada a 8kms del Departamento de Chontales junto a su esposo y sus dos  hijos, quienes están en edad escolar, la actividad comercial de Araceliz es la venta de cerdo en pie, también hacen fritanga para vender todos los días en su casa de habitación, el cual su esposo le ayuda a realizar la comida. Solicita el crédito para ir construyendo un anexo de cuarto que es de necesidad para sus hijos quienes comparten habitación, ella cuenta con parte del material, pero aun le falta comprar piedrínes, cemento, hierro, pago de mano de obra. Con esta inversión su familia obtendrá mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Araceliz lives in a county located eight kilometers from the department of Chontales, with her husband and two school-aged children.  She sells pigs and also sells fried foods from her home.  Her husband helps with the cooking.

Araceliz is requesting a loan to build another room for her children.  She has some of the materials but still needs to buy gravel, cement, and iron and to hire workers.  This investment will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy gravel, cement and iron, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is still single and is 25 years old.  He doesn't have a family to support. He is a farmer in the Kapsoo region and practices both livestock and crop farming.  He has been in operation for a period of one year earning an average monthly income of KES 12,000.

He is now requesting his second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, which he wishes to use to purchase farm inputs i.e fertilizers and seeds and to expand his current farm.  The profits he earns from this loan will be used to repay the loan and save for future developments.

His dream is to be blessed with a family and also expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilisers and seeds.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is from Tashir town. She lives together with her mother and has been involved in the retail business for four years. She sells clothing and different dressmaking supplies to the local people of Tashir town and also to neighbouring villagers. As there is a lack of stores in the town where Sona lives, her service is much demanded.

To increase her sales and be able to meet her clients' demand Sona needs financial support. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So the loan is very important for Sona to be able to purchase new stocks of clothing and dressmaking supplies and meet her clients' demand.

Sona hopes for lenders' support and will be very thankful to them.

loans.use: to purchase new stocks of clothing and dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Enkh-Ochir

texts.en:
Mr Enkh-Ochir, 49-years-old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger on a plot of land. His family income consists of his serviceman salary, his wife's salary and his son's earning from religious teaching. He has lived in a Mongolian traditional ger for many years and wants to live in a house as he is getting older day by day. So he began building the house foundations on his land this summer but due to a lack of finance, he can't advance the building work. 

Mr Enkh-Ochir is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase additional bricks. He is planning to complete his house before winter. He thinks living in a house will be better for both him and his wife as they are getting older and shouldn't catch cold. Also a high quality house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase additional bricks.

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo was born and lives in the village Tatev which is in Syunik region. Kamo is married and has a very large and nice family. He has five children; two daughters and three sons. Only the elder one has graduated from Medical College which is in Kapan city. His other children are still school-aged. His wife works at the hotel as a waitress, but she also has too much work about the house and too many family members to take care of. 

Kamo had worked for several years at the cheese factory as a worker and now he works as a locksmith. His wife’s and his salary is not enough for their big family, especially if we take into consideration that his elder daughter is going to get married which means a lot of new expenses will be incurred.
 
Kamo asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to be able to organize his elder daughter’s wedding party.

loans.use: to be able to organize his elder daughter’s wedding party.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 31-years-old and a poor lady.  Fozia and her family pass their lives in a very miserable condition. Because her husband does not earn sufficient income and his profession does not for get a high turnover. And most of the time his rickshaw remains out of order.  Although he earns money, he has to spend a part of his income on rickshaw maintenance. 

Therefore, Fozia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband can fully maintain his rickshaw and so that he could abstain from daily maintenance expenditures. 

Fozia hopes that the auto rickshaw will be in order for a long time. 

Fozia is very thankful to the Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Febe Priscila

texts.es: Febe de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable en sus labores además de ello tiene un buen record crediticio y muy buenas referencias personales  por parte de sus vecinos su profesión es ser costurera tiene su taller de costura ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela, Febe solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la compra de una maquina y tela para poder elaborar carteras y diferente prendas de vestir. Con ello tiene pensado  aumentar su inventario y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Febe, 29, lives in her own home with her husband.  She is a very responsible, hard-working person with a good credit record and very good personal references from her neighbors.  She works as a seamstress and has a sewing shop at home where she attends to many customers.

Febe is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric to make bags and clothes.  She wants to increase her inventory and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Clarice

texts.en:
Clarice is a very hard working, 38-year-old widow from Nakuru.  She has two children aged 16 and 14 years old.

She is a fish monger, she has been running a fish mongering business for the last five years and has applied for her first loan of Kshs. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd to enable her buy more stocks of fish to sell to her customers.

Her monthly income right now is Kshs. 15,000 and she intends to use profits realized from her expanded business to educate her children. In the future, Clarice's hopes and dreams is to own her own plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is married and has five children, four of whom attend school and one is still young. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children. 

For the past two years, she has operated a ground-nut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

She is requesting for a loan to purchase four sacks of ground-nuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of ground-nuts for sale.

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en: Sarkis is a 30-year-old man. He lives with his parents and his brother and sister-in-law in a small village in Marneuli district. His father receives a retirement pension. Sarkis is involved in agricultural activities. He has two pigs, a vineyard and 0.8 hectares of land where persimmon trees are grown. He is a very hardworking man and has always high quality products, which are sold to local retailers. Sarkis decided to begin trading in fruits and vegetables and applied for a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enabled him to obtaina loan of 2,000 GEL in order to purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables. He will buy and then resell them in various villages by car. The Start Up program will provide great support for Sarkis to increase his income.

loans.use: to begin trading in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Natsadorj

texts.en: Mr. Natsadorj, 46 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have been running a grocery store for three years and during this time they have amassed vast amount of experience even learning to record their balance sheet. Their daughter studies in Korea. He is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to buy food stuffs in large amounts from his supplier at wholesale price. As a result, he can continue to run his business without worrying about inventory shortage. This business is the main income source of his family as he sold hold his internet cafe for not running well.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs in large amount

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en: Lucas is 58 years old, married to Ruth, and they have four children who are in school. He has a carpentry business in Naivasha, which he has been running for five years, and he has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd, to enable him buy timber for his business. With anticipated profits, he plans to pay school fees and expand his business. He hopes to own the biggest workshop in Naivasha in the near future.

loans.use: to buy timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is 28 years old and from Nakuru, he is married to Carol who is a business woman and he has two children aged 5 and 2 years old.

He is in the business of selling mirrors and wooden spoons, which he has been running for the past seven years.  To help him buy more stock of his items, he has applied for his third loan of 100,000 KES from KADET.

His monthly income is currently 20,000 KES and he hopes to use profits from his expanded business for his children's education and to add stock to his wife's business.

In the future, Kassim hopes to buy a piece of land on which he will construct a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mirrors and wooden spoons to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is 29 years old and the father of 2 children, of whom all are currently studying in school. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling charcoal in Malindi where he earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES. Alfred was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and he is applying for his second loan of KES. 40,000 to purchase additional stock of charcoal needed for his business. He will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees for his children, purchase food for the family and expand the current business. Alfred hopes to own his own charcoal depot in future so as to improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a married woman who owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is for food for the family. She has operated a tailoring business for the past eight years. She makes women’s and men’s suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She also cooks and sells food to supplement her income. With this KES 20,000 loan, she wants to buy cloth and thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials and thread for her business.

loans.name: Mwamadi

texts.en: Mwamadi is a divorced woman with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She operates an open-air food business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. With this KES 30,000 loan, she wants to buy a supply of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy supply of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice for her open-air food business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 58 years old and married with three children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Emma has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Emma aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is not far from Masai land. He has 3 children and has been doing this work for 4 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Profitable!' His biggest challenge is 'Needs more time.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Sigisi.'

Abel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Good customer care.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to manage farming.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Abel replied 'Stable foundation.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Abel owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary banana and sugar cane growing region. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 4 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'the output gotten from farming.' Her biggest challenge is 'scarcity of time and resources.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyanzanako.'

Agnes was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Low interest.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to improve her farming.'

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Agnes replied 'they will be stable.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Agnes owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine'.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Thank you Kiva lender for lending to Samuel. He used the other loan to buy food stock for his food business. The business really grew after the loan term and now he wants to diversify. He started another business in the course of the previous loan using the income he raised and now he seeks a loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour and other retail products for the for the new business. When not in one of his businesses he is farming in his farm or teaching. The extra income will improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour and other retail products

loans.name: Mokweri

texts.en:
Mokweri lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is not far from Masai land. He has 3 children and has been doing this work for 4 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Good paying!' His biggest challenge is 'Needs more time and resources.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyabarati.'

Mokweri was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Faster disbursement.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to do farming.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Mokweri replied 'Stablize my family.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mokweri owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and a water tank.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is not far from Masai land. She has 5 children and has been doing this work for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'earnings she receives from farming' Her biggest challenge is 'a lot of time is consumed in farming.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyangera.'

Rose was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Low interest.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Care for our people.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Rose replied 'Will be stable.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rose owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump' but does not own 'pig, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is 50 years old, from Olkalou. She is single and has six children, aged 18, 16, 14, 12, 9 and 7. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which she has been operating for the past four years. To enable her buy a larger stock of these items, she has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd, for KES 10,000. Her monthly income is now KES 10,000, and she intends to use the profits from her expanded business to repay her loan and to expand her business further. In the future, Rahab hopes and dreams of buying a piece of land and building her own house

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is 29 years old, divorced, and has three children who are in school. She has a money transfer (M-pesa) business in Naivasha, which she has operated for three years. Shehas applied for her third loan from KADET Ltd, to increase the float of her M-pesa business. She plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and expand her business. She hopes to improve the living standards of her family In the near future.

loans.use: to increase the float of her money-transfer (M-pesa) business.

loans.name: Maripet

texts.en:
Maripet is 41 years old married to Noomali and a father of five children aged between 19 and 5 years of age. He is a livestock trader in Lower Melili area of Narok county, Kenya, and has been running the business for the past 7 years making a monthly income of KES 45000.
He has borrowed a 4th loan of KES 80000 from KADET which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be used for farming. Maripet hopes to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a lady of thirty five years, married to Micheal and a mother of three children. She is a tailor and has been in this business for seven years now. She gets a monthly income of fifty five thousand shillings.

This will be Tabitha's first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy materials for making clothes. In future she wants to be a prosperous business lady.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes and thread

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a married mother of five children, who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for food. Rehema cooks fried potatoes and sells them to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. With this KES 50,000 loan, she wants to buy a sack of potatoes and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and a sack of potatoes for her business, frying and selling potatoes.

loans.name: Agneta

texts.en: Agneta lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is a 27-year-old businesswoman and the mother of one. She is trained as a tailor, which is her business. She has been in business for the past four years, and the business has been growing nicely. She has one employee in her business. She heard of Milango through friends, and now she is applying for a loan to buy material for the business. The challenge she faces in business is competition. The extra income she earns will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Jargalsaikhan, 47 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in house on plot of land. He has been making and selling wooden products to local people since 2003. His elder three children all got married and live on their own. He is requesting a loan of 4200000 MNT to purchase planks and other raw materials in large amount. This business is the main income source for the family and he is searching for ways to increase work efficiency.

loans.use: to purchase planks in large quantity

loans.name: Khurelbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Khurelbaatar, 49 years old, lives with his wife, son and daughter in law in Kherlen, easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been rendering transportation service to local people since 2011. His son is a policeman and works at the town police department. This summer, he demolished his former house as the house no longer provided his family with appropriate protection. Immediately he began building new house on his former house's foundation. But due to lack of finance, up until now he didn't complete building work and his family is currently residing in a Mongolian traditional ger which lacks necessary protection against snow and storms. So he is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement and planks. Using those materials, he will be able to build his new house before winter. The house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Corazones De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZONES DE ORO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y esta dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, venta de verduras, venta de leche y queso, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de leche y queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás, ya que es un negocio familiar, posteriormente a su matrimonio decide emprender su propio espacio de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de terneritas) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas a su comunidad y posteriormente a la crianza del mismo y la elaboración de los productos lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Corazones de Oro communal bank will start the first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Copacabana. It is made up of eight members and is managed by a Board where Juana is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank undertake are varied, including blanket weaving, selling vegetables, selling milk and cheese, and running a neighborhood store.

The loan that they have taken out will help micro entrepreneurs such as Juana; she states that she became a member of Pro Mujer six months ago, entering at the invitation of a promoter of the institution who came to visit her in her home. She currently has a business selling milk and cheese, which informs us that she learnt this trade several years ago as it is a family business. After getting married, she decided to start her own sales area.
